text:
Okay Lux, I can move you up a star. I'm still not a fan that most of the time it's hard to find a seat and have it be quiet enough to focus on anything. Additionally, I am sad that my favorite shoe chair that was an important part of an evening I had with Tony A. seems to no longer be there.

However, when I came back this past Saturday for a velvet with your homemade whipped cream, you truly delivered. It was the perfect temperature and a million times better than the last one I remembered. Bravo. Now move closer to my house and we'll be all set.
This is a very cool place and great coffee and pastries. The bad part is the music is way too loud that its sorta irritating.
Amazing place.  Their food is fantastic and the vibes make it the perfect place to sit down and socialize, chill, or do work.

Super cool, chill place. Vegas needs one of these. No doubt a great spot to meet up w friends or to brainstorm. Lots of cool peeps here too. I'll be back. Couches and seats a plenty. Plenty of space. Maybe a Vegas version would be open even later ;)

That moment when you order your "favorite" thing... when you taste it, it's so delicious you get angry at all the impostures that made you order it to begin with!

This happens to me anytime I adventure away from my usual order at lux.  This has happened to me here the first time I've ordered the americano, the yogurt parfait, and the scones. The bakers here are legit le cordon bleu graduates from what I hear (and taste).  

The brown sugar macadamia scone is this glistening golden glimmer of a pastry with a crumbly biscuit texture on the outside and gooey butter cream in the center.  When I first laid eyes on the one selected for me I actually thought "she gave me the good one!" It had me asking deep questions about the universe.  

At times, the line is long but no worries the staff actually is efficient and gets through it in minutes.  The only downside is the coffee condiment area is booty to booty with the people ordering & paying.  No worries as everyone moves through pretty quickly. 

The decor and art at lux is perfection: hip coffee atmosphere achieved.  Literally, the best people watching with 2 outdoor areas.

Usually I'll eat inside and then enjoy my pastry outside because I like to bring my Jack Russell terrier and tie her on the bench in front of pane bianco.  

My final tip- if it sounds or looks good definitely order it.

I enjoyed the coffee and the breakfast. The first time you go it's a little bit hectic, and it might just be a little to trendy for me. I'll probably be back at some point but not in the near future. The prices were fair, it was super busy when we went but we didn't wait long for anything.

I think this place is great. My only negative is that they are too busy and seem to be short staffed at times.  But what local business doesn't have that problem? Their coffee is amazing, their baked goods are delectable, and it is so cute inside.  I just wish I could find a seat :)

This place is just so cool. So cool that it makes me feel kind of uncool. And I'm pretty cool...

Come here for delicious drinks, sweet pastries, and awesome atmosphere. Grab a seat at a table full of typewriters or on a hip, leather couch. Wear something funky so you fit in with all the cool kids.

Trying a meal is next on my list.

I went to high school in the semi-neighborhood in the late 90s (damn, when did I get old?), and if my memory serves me correctly, Lux was actually open then. It was very hip, actually too hip for me, as I found the servers and the atmosphere very cold and unwelcoming...maybe even mean. Well, a lot of time passed, Lux changed buildings I think, and I was hearing great things about it from Claire F, who still lives in Phoenix. So ~12 years later, I gave it another try, and this time, it totally wowed me. 

It's still hip. Like super hip. But this time, everyone is friendly enough to make you feel really welcome. The furniture and decor are really eclectic and thrift-store cool. The crowd is pretty varied - on a Saturday night there were a few people too young to sit at the bar, mostly 25-35s, and a few 50+ sitting eating or reading or working on their laptops.

My favorite part of Lux is that it has a little section devoted to everything: a to-go counter for the bakery items; a more 'restaurant-y' area with bigger tables for ordering off the full dinner menu which varies nightly; a bar area where you can sit at the bar and converse with the bartenders or at smaller cocktail tables; a back room where you can watch a movie or chat; and a quiet room which has no music so you can utilize the free wifi.

We didn't eat dinner, but the menu looked interesting - the special that night was some kind of steak with veggies. We did have desserts (awesome, especially the salted chocolate chip cookie) and drinks (excellent beer list, and 'collaborative' cocktails. Seriously, you just talk to the bartender about what you like).

To top it all off, the walls are filled with the work of local artists, they have a big patio on Central (near the light rail!) and it's located next to Pane Bianco.

If you think you're not cool enough to hang out here, you're not. But they won't hold it against you.

I try to go to Lux as often as possible but I still have mixed feelings about it. 

The cappuccino is wonderful; one of my favorites! I can't say that enough! I recommend making a trip to try one if you haven't! The food is always tasty and unique. If you can find a good place to sit I would try ordering one of the items on their menu, really fantastic! All of the pastries I have tried have been delicious also! I am telling you, you need to go!

The only reason Lux gets a 4 instead of 5 is because of the atmosphere. When I go its hit or miss, most of the time I get the impression they are way too hipster - bordering pretentious - to care about your experience. The following are just a couple examples:

I wanted to try a drink at their full bar one night, so I asked one of the employee's behind the bar what he had in his hand and he responded with "ice". Yes, there was a piece of ice held in a pair of tongs in one hand, but he also had a cocktail in the other hand... Following his response, he walked away from me and never returned to ask if I had any interest in ordering a drink or to give me any clue about what he'd been making. Most restaurants and employee's attempt to make you feel involved and entice you to purchase something, but no such luck. Unfortunately that experience was followed by another unpleasant one at the bar on a different night, so I haven't felt inclined to drink there again. 

I had another recent experience with lux when I ordered a quiche from the front. We waited 10 minutes for them to heat it up but it was never called. So we checked and they said "oh, it must still be in the oven".. Although, didn't bother checking on the item or why this was taking so long to heat (since its already cooked). After another 10 minutes we checked with the front again and she finally went to check and said, "Oh, I guess its been in the oven the whole time". Needless to say it was overdone. The staff didn't apologize or offer a replacement, sadly this didn't impress my friend who hadn't been to Lux.

I still say you should go, the food and espresso are amazing. I just wish they would come back down to earth a little bit.

My iced coffee was really good.  The place was pretty crowded and had a nice vibe about it.  Music wasn't my favorite but not bad.  The only negative comment I have is the furniture is really kind of gross.  It is almost like they got it from curbside on garbage day! lol  I would go back though.

I went back to Lux the other day and sat at the bar. I told the bartender I didn't want soda and I didn't want alcohol. He made me this amazing concoction of lemonade, a fresh lemon, cherry flavoring, and fresh mint. It was delicious! I told him he should put it on the menu. You should go order one so he will actually do it.

Also the fact that I was doing my college homework at a bar made me laugh, but they said they're used to it and all the med students come there to do homework and drink.

The cafe that changed my opinion of this town.

Lux is the kind of place middle aged women go to pretend they are hip, the place where you won't find any seating unless you come at an odd hour, and most of all the place where I find myself pretending to study but end up just being amazed at people who are actually studying.

Best coffee in town, considering the size of the kitchen and that they do all their baking and cooking in here, the size of the menu and the outcomes of every dish that I've had in the last 4 years are astonishing, from pastries to quiche, mac and cheese to steak dinners this place can make whatever you're craving with honors. Also probably the most hipster bar I've ever seen, but boy do they do it right. Wonderful cocktails and decent beer and wine selection. 

To some it's a magical place, to others it's a over-hyped coffee shop. Either ways this place has established itself and definitely deserves a try.

I love the soups at Lux. Different every day & served with the most yummie bread. However, the last few times I have been here including today, the soup is completely blended. Didn't see a soup spoon & I feel like a baby feeding myself liquid food. If it was on the menu that this was yet another texture- less soup, I would have ordered something else. I usually look forward to coming here & when the food is disappointing... It's an extra bummer. 

Please Lux! At least let us know on the menu that soup is completely blended. Ugh

What a cool little cafe, with a DJ playing early in the morning, delicious berry corn muffins, and good coffee. A little loud for my taste at that hour, but quite a popular little joint, and lots of regulars. Cool artwork on the walls. I was staying nearby for a few days, and for me, this was definitely the best part of this neighborhood.

Their pastries are my absolute fave. Their iced teas are good too, but I wasn't very impressed with their coffee. The pancake I had was absolutely to die to and way too big for me... recommend and visit when I can.

Thought i'd update my review, with the new locale being open;

coffee, pastries, and environment all maintain their top-shelf qualities. inside seating room was always an issue, but not near as much anymore. And the places to sit are all very hip, cool set-ups - not just 10 look-a-like tables and chairs. 

My only problem? How they've laid out their customer flow. One prob at the old place was there was always an awkward bottleneck of people waiting for their drinks... and to my amazement, they've cloned the problem at their new place! Unreal! Whoever space-planned the new layout should be shot! "i have an idea - because this place gets really busy, lets direct the long line of people into a little circle in front of the register, make this the same spot people wait for \/ pickup their drinks, and also the same place people use the condiment bar, and we'll have everyone awkwardly climbing over each other. Perfect!"

That said, their coffee is still the best in town. So there's that too.

Oh Lux, my biggest enemy. Every time I go I cannot help but get 1 or 2 of their delicious pastries. How can one place be so delicious?!? Oh man and there Jalepeno Bacon Mac n Cheese is insanely good! One of the best places in Phoenix in my opinion
The pumpkin pie is awesome!!!! The scone was good.  The atmosphere is cool and I totally recommend this place for anytime of meet-up!

I dare you to walk in this hipster coffee shop and not want to eat all their delicious pastries and drinks! However, if you want to get any work done, bring headphones because they keep their music very high to the point where you think your ears might be bleeding. And outlets are sparse.
Great coffee, great food, and a great environment for all types of occasions. Work, study, or hanging out it's a great place!

Hands down, the best place to get a cup of coffee in Phoenix (and I've drank a lot of coffee in my days). Atmosphere could not be better, with funky furniture and art throughout the place. The pastries never disappoint. Tends to be crowded, and rightfully so. It's worth your visit.
Love this place. My friend recommended me this place and I loved it from the first step inside. Food is awesome. Environment cozy and easygoing. Super!

Their iced coffee is good! I love the food here because everything is made from scratch! The desserts are almost always yummy! The wifi is great too, awesome place to do homework. But do not come on Friday's or Sunday's to do homework! It's busy busy busy!

Popular spot! This little gem is definitely a trendy spot as you can find all types of people from different backgrounds. One of the times I went on the weekend they had a DJ set up playing music. It's a nice touch, however a little loud to have a conversation with another person. 
They have a couple different sitting areas so take a look around. 
I suggest going earlier, because when 9am hits, it's almost difficult to find somewhere to sit. There is a nice enclosed patio as well.
Prices for food are on the high side in my opinion, but I'm sure it's due to the trendiness of the place. Food and drinks are very good! I really enjoy the latte as it's not mostly milk like most places!
What a genius idea - half coffee shop \/ half bar! Nice place - fast, friendly service  - fancy looking cocktails (haven't tried yet) - coffee is organic and tasty.

I've heard a lot about this place, so I decided to make the trek out to Lux Coffeebar and get some work done. There's a parking lot right next to it with ~15 or so spots. Or, you could street park for free, but it seemed a  bit packed bc the nearby apt residents park there I think. It's in the same vicinity as a pizza place as well.

I slipped inside and it was darker than I imagined it would be. Fairly full - and I went at noon on a Friday. There were tons of pastries and baked goods [~$1.50-4] behind a glass barrier - leading up to a line of people ordering at the cash register. All the workers were so friendly.

I just ordered hot coffee to stay [$2], which comes in a ceramic coffee cup and free refills! The coffee tasted very smooth and not bitter at all. 

The seating\/table arrangement is very interesting - a combination of regular tables and just armchairs w\/ coffee tables and a bar. Lux was also louder than I expected it would be - the music was playing fairly loud in the background, which made everyone else speak over that.

But overall, I would love to come back and try their actual food and sweets.

Went to Lux on a Saturday morning for the first time. It was packed and the line was from the counter to the door. Lucky for me, I was in line in front of John a frequent customer who told me that during the week there is not usually a line and he is usually in and out. I ordered the Egg sandwich and a caramel latte both were very good and the prices were not bad. I was very happy that they offer both almond and soy milk as an option. I look forward to returning during the week  or on a weekend night and having a more relaxed experience.

My friend and I decided to grab some coffee at this place after finishing lunch next door at Pane Bianco. It was pretty crowded and everyone seemed really into whatever they were doing on their Macs. I got an iced coffee with half and half and was pleasantly surprised with how fresh the coffee tasted. We ended up finding a cozy spot inside and our quick coffee run turned into almost  4hrs of "working" and talking. I can see how people can spend the entire day at this place!

The staff seemed friendly enough but overall an out right terrible experience. To start the line is absurd. The place is packed shoulder to shoulder with your typical hippy\/trendy mid to late twenties types. After waiting for what seems like an eternity you get to the front to place an order only to find out their out of almost every thing on the menu. At $4 for a single cup of sub par black coffee and 20+ min wait times, unless you're tied up in trying to be one of the 'cool' kids there's no reason to visit this establishment.

An unexpected find in the desert! I asked for an espresso-based sweet drink and the barista hooked me up with their black and white with house made whipped cream. Perfect balance of smooth and sweet. Right up there with the best I've ever had.

Being from SF I know Blue Bottle, so any place that serves Blue Bottle I have got to try and gets 4 Stars in my book just for serving the coffee.  Being a recent SF transplant to Phx I am starving for a taste of the city.  I will go to Lux as soon as possible and file a review.

Super busy, but not in a bad way. Awesome vibe. An eclectic mix of people congregating, working, relaxing. Great drinks. Bartender seemed very much accustom to their drink menu only, though. Went in the afternoon. Curious to see it at night.

Overrated, trendy. Trying to be more than a coffee shop. 

A bar, really?


Shitty parking.
Crowded. Annoying. Ok coffee, but since everyone in AZ thinks Starbucks is good, go figure.

Unimpressed.

I was looking for a neighborhood joint that wasn't a chain and I found one with Lux.  

It's a neighborhood coffee in the truest sense. You've got all your regular characters - dude who looks like Jesus, hippie chick in her cool hippie skirt, aspiring artists (one overweight hipster even wearing a beret), couples pulling up on bicycles, old guys reading the paper. Truly local people with a sense of silent comaraderie - you just KNOW not to be yapping on your cell in there.

You can feel comfortable and feel like you can disappear for a few hours.  Good, solid espresso drinks, free WiFi.  If you live in the area, you should definitely be a patron and support this local spot (as opposed to Starbucks down the street on Lola up the street).  

I dig it.

Great customer service and Great Coffee! The owner knows what he's doing by hiring friendly baristas and bakers and providing quality pastries!  If the other coffee shops around town took notes and adopted similar ways of doing business, they would soon find their businesses to be booming, just like Lux!
Nothing best praise, absolutely great. Had the grilled chicken pesto mac n' cheese yesterday. AMAZING!
Great coffee, great atmosphere, and yummy yummy food! Doesn't get any better than Lux
Yes I have, the Bloody Mary's are the best I have ever had.

This place is great! I love coming here to hang out and grab a coffee. I usually bring my laptop and music and zone out to get work done. I've met some really interesting people here. I really love it and go often

I finally made it here, after it being on my "to breakfast" list for months.
A mocha was quite nice, and the chorizo biscuits & gravy were out of this world. The layout was a bit baffling for a n00b, and I'm thankful I had a veteran Luxer there to guide me through the food and drink-ordering.

Love this place. Great hangout spot to work on your computer for whatever you are doing. The food is descent and the deserts are pretty good. There are a lot of people so be ready for crowds but there  are plenty of spots and comfy couches to sit on so make yourself comfortable and stay a while,

I come from the PNW where we take our coffee seriously, and this is seriously good coffee! 

I'm lucky enough to live nearby, so I visit LUX often, and the coffee, pastries, food and service are always consistent. And consistently good! 

Ok, it can be a bit confused and chaotic at the register when there's a crowd, but be patient, and I believe you'll  be delighted with your experience. 
 
I refuse to use any variations of the h*p word, because you see all sorts there, and that's a big part of the fun!

I like this place because it's super chill looking, it smells great and they have a lot of tasty looking pastries. 
I don't like this place because it's always extremely packed and sometimes because of that, I don't get my order because someone else picks it up or something. 
Luckily I've always been able to find a spot to sit in but it's difficult to sometimes speak to the people you're with because so many other people are talking and it's loud. 
Overall, okay experience!
Sometimes you just need to say ,"eff the environment!" and drive 25 miles for a delicious mocha.

4 of us dined at Charleston's Restaurant in Mesa Grande Center on May 28, 2015. As usual the food and service was excellent. We have never failed to have a lovely experience at this restaurant. We have tried a number of the menu items and the only one that failed to please was the blackened catfish. It did not live up to the usual standards for taste. Last nigh 2 of our party ordered from the Gluten Free menu, which was exceptional, and both had the trout, exchanging the rice for mashed potatoes and adding glazed carrots, one of our faves.. The trout was done well and made a very tasty dinner. It is often difficult to find a good gluten free dish and sometimes restaurants fail to understand the necessity to make it truly gluten free which can result tin consequences for the diner who needs the dish to be gluten free. These dishes were delivered separately by the chef who confirmed that they were gluten free. The service at Charlestons is always exceptional and we left having had another pleasant experience.

There's just something different about this place that I absolutely love. The pictures posted on Yelp don't do it justice. There are multiple rooms with couches and tables, quaint corners where you can get some work done. The atmosphere is to the T, and their coffee\/eats are delicious. The place can get a little loud and hectic, so bring your headphones or come at an off hour if you're looking to make some power moves with your work. There's something a little Starbucks about the way they run the front, but the staff is friendly and this place has so much to offer over your typical coffee shop experience. 

Overall, if you want great coffee and a lively atmosphere, head to Lux.

First time ever going....fantastic!!! Environment was better than expected.  I got a Vodka Grapefruit Martini that hit the spot.  I can't wait to go back and get coffee and goodies!! I'm a definite fan and will be a regular for sure!

i love, love, love lux coffee.  can't drink it there as the place is always too packed.  could sit on the front patio but it's tooooo hot right now.  so i take it with me which is fine.  their coffee is the best in the valley as far as i'm concerned (ok the LGO spanish latte is also dang good).  

i have learned to embrace the multiple body piercings as part of the extreme coffee deluxe picture.   that coffee, it's enough to melt a girls heart.

the chocolate chip cookies were incredible at one time.  don't know if they still are.  the woman who used to make them had her mother or grandmothers receipe.  as for the rest of their heavenly offerings, haven't had a bad calorie laden snack there yet.

When I walked into lux I must say I was mesmerized by all that was going on. There was so much to see that caught my eye and many choices of food, drinks, pastries etc. that I could have been overwhelmed but wasn't because I was so excited! I am visiting the area for two weeks and I was already there three times and it is only the first week. I will certainly go back several more times.  Super excited I went!!!
Solid coffee lounge\/ bar! i highly recommend it to any fan of interesting little nooks in a large city. Definitely for those looking to explore the individual unique experiences.
Great place to drink coffee with a friend or do your academic work and very easy to bring your dog. Everybody who works at Lux is great!!!

Great brews and vibes all around. Perfect for those have to be hipster nights and while it gets busy there is always place to sit and chill outside (could be literal depending on temperature of said outside) my
Wife had the chai latte and I had a velvet latte and both tasted great. We both also tried some pumpkin whoopie pies that were also great. Our party tried a mix off their menu and even a large coffee mug of Mac n cheese. Everyone seemed to enjoy what they ordered and no real complaints. The restaurant and restrooms were clean and the staff was quite friendly as well. I would recommend lux to my yelp friends as well and it's worth a try. From what I understand they do have wifi available and showcase local art on their walls which is always a plus. Check them out !

What can I say?  Lux is a good spot with good food and good coffee. I had a salted chocolate chip cookie with my latte last night and it was delicioso.  I frequent this joint at night to work on the computer.  It's comfortable and the people are generally friendly.  A few of the reviews whine about the "fake Scottsdale" people and the "hipsters" that they have encountered at Lux.  Are you kidding me?!  The people are half the reason I go here- sightseeing!  If you're looking for a place where everyone looks the same and acts like a robot you'll be better served getting your caffeine at the ubiquitous coffee shop with the 'baristas" donning the green aprons.

I have been here half a dozen times.  Love the energy, dessert and coffee drinks.  Most important is i love the happy kids that work here!   This is just a great place with an awesome hipster vibe.  Took 4 girlfriends here and they loved everything about the Lux.  The norm for me is start at the Tiki and walk to the Lux for dessert!  Try it a great game plan!!

You'll think you're in Silver Lake, not Phoenix.  Everything about it is cool - the DJ was so good I got his card - and the vibe was just perfect for a Sunday morning.  People chillin' here and there, keeping to themselves mostly, just the way it should be.  And I didn't even get to the food:  you must order the pancake thingy.  An A+ find.
Great place.  I've been coming here for years.  Best coffee in town and the staff are friendly and kind.
Busy atmosphere with great coffee and snacks!

I couldn't love this place anymore. The music, the people, the coffee, the pastries, the atmosphere. They blow everyone away and invite them back to enjoy a relaxed productive or chill time. Anytime Any day of the week. 

And yes. I'm writing this review right now here. At lux.

Amazing Ambiance!!!  Adorable Packaging!!!  Delish Rice Krispie Treats!  Burnt Acidic Coffee.   :(
I wish I could have had the time to exchange the latte I ordered, but the line was long and I was in a rush.  
I would totally give them another try, if I'm in that groovy part of town and need a bump.
Chill place with great coffee and fun cocktails. A must hit spot in Central Phx.

This place is great. Picked up a dozen pastries for an office and everything looked so good. A staff member said the quiche was really good. Unfortunately I didn't stay for breakfast. I saw a plate while I was walking out and I was so jealous. The next time I'm in town I'm going to stop here!

I'm a huge fan of Lux, Great hipster atmosphere, everything on the menu is great.  Make sure you bring your MacBook or iPad and you'll fit right in.  The place is not very big and its usually busy so you might not be able to find a place to sit right away.
Great environment great  staff,  boring People... You will only feel welcome and feel that you can fit in if you have people you know already that you bring in there with you to drink coffee

The place is great, plenty of room, one of my favorite places to do my work. It's always filled with guests because it's a cool place to go spend a couple of hours. The food on the other hand is not worth it. They try, but it's not worth the price, I've tried a few things on the menu & I'm convinced their drinks are far superior.

If you like pretentious, pseudo-intellectuals who have not bathed this year yet, please, check out lux. if you like overly loud, poorly thrown back hipster groove music, please, check out lux. maybe you like to watch a 60 year old dj spinning "music" from his laptop in the back on friday mornings at a decibel louder than your neighbor's new harley that was purchased to fulfill his midlife crisis. if you do, check out lux. the reason for the loud music? the dj forgets to bring his hearing aids. the music is made by people who listened to the beastie boys' check ya head and thought they could do better. it is possible the bands thought they could outdo music from "santa claus conquers the martians." 

if you wish to have some sort of conversation with anyone in which you would like to hear as well as be heard, do not go to lux. sure the patio is nice, but that only lasts a few weeks in the year. the "art" on the walls, and i use that term very loosely (the only thing being looser is my ex), is boring, amateurish and made by someone who feels that they are the stand-out prize in their community college art class. evidently, the artists find that one effect on photoshop that they cannot do without. it is called solarize and it went the way of the shampoo that the patrons have long since forgotten. 

on a bright note, and there is only one, the pastries and food are amazing. everything is made fresh daily and they are exquisite. it is this single reason that this place gets one star. she alone has earned that. 

bring sanitary wipes in case you decide to go and try this place out. i have seen dogs cleaner than the pants on some of those who frequent this place. 

and before anyone gripes -- why don't you just go somewhere else? -- i respond, i no longer can stand this place. i tried, i really did, to like it. i wanted very much to like it. but, sad to say, i have moved on to greener pastures, one where bathing is not something considered taboo.

I have visited Lux on a few different occasions and have to agree with so many others that their coffee and drinks are some of the best in Phoenix. I think it all starts with their beans (which you can buy) because I could have their espresso straight all day long! But they still manage to make it even more delicious as they create beautiful latte art with the steamed milk. I'm convinced they have some secret ingredient they aren't telling us about! 

Then there's the environment! There's a wide array of people that come to Lux. Anyone from business men to chill creatives walk through the doors on any given day, but there is plenty of room for everyone! If you follow the hallway past the bathroom, you'll find some hidden treasures, 2 more rooms full of seating options! There's a spot for everyone's liking. Though it can be difficult to find seating for groups of people as many of Lux's customers are flying solo. However, if you and your posse wander around long-enough, there is probably one nice coffee-loving friend who will give up their lone seat at a table for you! 

I look forward to visiting Lux again and setting up camp somewhere in that hidden treasure of a back room!

If your looking for a fabulous place to have some coffee, meet with friends, waste some time or grab a bite to eat, Lux is the place. This local coffee shop is better than any chain coffee place.  Walk into this place and you will know why.

The atmosphere is a place where you can grab a seat on a couch and relax and enjoy your coffee or meal.  This is a great place to bring a lap top and do some work or play. This is a place that you could visit any time of the day or night.  Reminds me of a little coffee shop in downtown Denver that I used to visit. 

The coffee is delicious and they have delicious pastries if you like. The only reason I give this a four star is they don't offer a Thai iced tea. :(

OMG the coffee at this place is UNREAL. My first time going i was impressed alone with how amazing the coffee was, then a regular recommended the in-house made whip cream... its now a MUST. I drive 20 min out of my way to get coffee here, the service is always amazing, the food and drinks are amazing and the place itself is so cute and funky. You have to try the whip!

Lux is a super trendy Downtown Phoenix coffee shop. I love coming here with my friends after a long day of class and enjoying some of their mac n'cheese (served in a coffee mug!) and sipping on one of their amazing cappuccinos. You can even tell them what you want in a drink, and they'll whip something special up for you!

Lux is appropriate: Daytime, nighttime, by yourself, with a friend, with a group, on a date, studying, working, people watching, zoning out looking at your caffeine, or alcoholic beverage, of choice (they have Henderick's gin btw).

I always get a London fog (earl grey latte with vanilla) and get brunch.  It's busy and loud, but they get through the line quickly and the food and baked goods make for a perfect morning.  There are multiple rooms, benches, couches, cute  !@# chairs, tables for groups, outside seating... you have options! I've enjoyed this place with friends for years and I hope it always remains a happy little part of Phoenix.

Both the atmosphere and the coffee here are divine. A captivating menu and rousing bar make this place a sure fire bet. When it's time to go for coffee and "get to know each other better", no one does the scene better than Lux.
My family and I go here every weekend and most weeknights. We absolutely love this place. Great breakfast in the morning and amazing cocktails in the evening. No other place like it.
Order the black and white and you won't be disappointed. I docked them a star due to the high volume of hipsters permitted to sit all throughout the coffee house like vagabonds.

I feel like I'm not cool enough for Lux, but occasionally when I'm there I feel a little bit cool. It's incredibly busy every day of the week, but for good reason! 
They're got great coffee, great pastries, great atmosphere and great people watching. I've heard they also have great mac & cheese. 
I'm a huge fan of the Americano here, not bitter at all and the espresso is pulled nice and strong. 
Chocolate chip cookie sandwich to die for, but get a beverage to cut the sweetness. I've had brownies, cake, lemon bars and cookies. I haven't encountered anything at Lux I haven't loved.
WAIT THEY ALSO HAVE COCKTAILS. Where else can you get coffee, pastries and handcrafted cocktails? Huge fan of the manhattan.

I've been a regular at Lux for the past 5 years. I can't believe I haven't written a review! Over the years it has been a great place to mingle, kill time, meet new people, study, eat and drink! All the workers are very friendly and most of the time they will remember your face. I love ordering the honey velvet with almond milk. It's a great way to start my day. For breakfast I usually get the egg sandwich with bacon cheese and tomatoes. Delicious! It has been becoming more popular now which is awesome for the business. You kinda have to dodge the times people get out of class or work, if you want a peaceful study session. But I always enjoy my time here. Thank you Lux :)

Awesome place to study and hang out! The tables are large enough so you could throw your backpack's whole life on it! I love that there are different environments all in one spot. The ambiance is quite attractive! So far I've tried their soy dirty chai, soy vanilla latte, chocolate chip cookie, and the jalapeño Mac and cheese! Yummy!

Good coffee. I bought 4 bags and all my friends were asking where I got those. I tried their pastry every bite was delicious. Their fruit omelet was light & delicious. I will try their pulled pork sandwich next time. The girl next to me ordered it and it looked so yummy. Be prepared to stand in line though cuz they obviously have many loyal customers.

Think i would have liked this place better if i didn't go during it's busy hours....8 in the morning! 

 Parking is a dive, had to park infront of the pawn shop--wishing the owner wouldnt come out and smash up my car!!  

But overall, the coffee(iced) was amazingly good and stronge!  Which i love, makes for an interesting work day that's for sure....

Will go back, but during slower hours.

I have came here once before, late at night to have some tea and the first time i loved it! Everyone was so nice so i thought i would bring my roommate the next time. Worst idea ever. The girl at the register was so rude. She messed up my order (which i didnt even care about we had all the time) and when i asked her they my chai latte was supposed to be to go she gave me this look and gave me a different coffee that was a small and i had ordered a medium. I really dislike going some where to pay to be treated like crap. Definitely not okay and wont be coming back.

Not sure why this place is so hyped up because the reviews say it so hipster but Arizona hipster is a bit more southwest colorful style vs the minimal hipster coffee shops we have in Seattle. This place had a good bakery selection but not a great place for lunch. I was starving so got a date bar which was huge! And I do like that their freshly flavored iced teas are bottomless :)

Great atmosphere. Great for after dinner location for a date, casual morning coffee, late night tea, you name it. 

Always busy so can be noisy! Bring earphones if you want to get work done. So not a place to get-to-know-each-other for the first time kind of place.

But for beverages --great coffee, tea and fresh squeezed juices. 
Awesome breakfast, especially the veg baked toast!  

For how busy it is tonight, I still got my drink in a timely manner :) Wellness tea (almond milk) latte! Yum!

I love going here. I really, really do, just to have that said off the bat. But there are some important things to understand about Lux.

1) Seating is always limited. Not even on a Tuesday night in July will this place be quiet and empty. Own that fact, love it, and keep looking.

2) The cocktails are phenomenal. There's no list of specialty cocktails. They go by requests for what you like, and make something that percolates in their brains all quick like. They also use beautiful glassware, which is really nice when you think about how rare that is.

3) It's actually kind of unfortunate that the cocktails eclipse the food. Lux is probably some of the best food you can get at its price point. If you think $19 for a steak is too much, just order it and keep in mind you'd pay $25 for cooking on that order at any other establishment. The same goes for literally everything else their fabulous cooks prepare. You can't go wrong with the soup, and I assure you the mac & cheese is a full meal.

4) They actually have newspapers! Real ones that you hold with your hands for the patrons to enjoy and leave behind! That basically makes Lux one of the most active town halls in the city of Phoenix.

5) They play full albums of good music, and not just rando indie bands people brag about having heard of. This is a place that appreciates Beyonce as much as all those weird bands whose names you can't remember.

There are a lot of things I don't understand about Lux. I don't get why people take selfies with their lattes. I don't understand why they have a DJ, but I'm glad he has a regular gig. I don't understand  why there are non-functional typewriters strewn about the place. But you know what? I keep coming back. We all keep coming back.

I went to Lux for a change of studying atmosphere the other evening.  I was lucky enough to find a seat at a table to get down to business.  

This is my second visit to Lux and both times I truly enjoyed the pastry I treated myself to and my coffee.  My soy latte was perfect.  The staff is friendly and the crowd is diverse.  I enjoyed the music and atmosphere.  Lux always seems to be a busy spot and I can see why.  While everyone seems to love Lux, I'm not in love with it, but then again, I'm very picky.  ;)

I just discovered this place and I live down the street.  I went there last night and have a feeling I will be back many, many more times.  I had the chocolate salted caramel pie and a velvet coffee drink.  Both were excellent.  It was very crowded but the wait was not long to pay and get my items.  My only complaint is that it's very hard to find the menu.  I want to go back for dinner but I literally couldn't find the menu for dinner, so I have no idea what they have.  I saw people eating mac and cheese, so I know they have dinner foods.
Want something other than the corporate espresso bar?  Go  to Lux!

Cool little coffee shop and breakfast restaurant. Hidden from the street and generally unmarked, but turns out to be a hidden gem. Pastries are good and coffee is quick and of high quality. Breakfast looked and smelled delicious. Entrance is in the back.

At long last, my first visit to Lux.  Located right across the street from Central High (my alma mater).  I'm not a coffee drinker, but was intrigued by the food and the atmosphere.  Not much for me to add to the numerous reviews about this place, but its pretty much as advertised.  Good food, quirky setup, crazy busy.  Its a coffee house first and foremost, but they also have a wine and cocktail bar.  Its a bakery that serves breakfast, but also has a lunch and dinner menu that changes regularly.  Sort of reminds me a little of La Grande Orange Grocery in that it has multiple personalities depending on the time of day.  Sometimes places that try to do everything well often don't do anything well.  But like LGO, this place is an exception.

I came here on a Saturday morning around 7am.  My timing was perfect as the crowds started streaming in shortly thereafter.  Parking can be a chore as there's maybe 15 spaces in their main lot, so be prepared to park along Turney Ave (which also happens to be overflow parking for the apartment complex next door).  You walk up towards the front counter and get teased by a smorgasbord of tantalizing pastries and can also order off the menu on the wall.  The sweet dutch pancake with fruit intrigued me so I grabbed that.  Also got sides of their bacon and hash, since those also seemed to be feature breakfast items.  Along with an OJ, total price for breakfast with tax came to about $18.  You order up front and pay, then seat yourself and wait for the kitchen to call out your name.  I can see how this could be troublesome when its busy.  While there's plenty of seating in back, the front area can get crowded and noisy really fast making it difficult to hear your order called out or navigate the throngs of patrons.  Fortunately, no such trouble for me this morning as I got my food within 10 minutes of ordering.

Sat down at the bar area up front (which is full stocked by the way).  The food was pretty solid.  The veggie hash was mostly potato, but you could pick up the carrots and other veggies mixed in.  The bacon was fantastic.  I'm not sure where they source it from, but the bacon strips were thick cut and the taste was nothing like your store brand bacon.  As for the pancake, mixed feelings on this.  A great assortment of fruit and they put on plenty of whipped cream on top.  The pancake itself was good, but honestly tasted like an afterthought.  It was super thin almost like a taco bowl and fell apart pretty easily when I cut into it.  Didn't hinder the taste at all, but the presentation was such that it was just sort of there.  Still, a tasty breakfast that left me full and satisfied.

I'll be back at some point for a lunch or dinner go round.  And next time I probably won't be able to resist those pastries.  Overall, I can see why this place is so popular with the CenPho crowd.  You'll see suits, students, and joggers alike in this place.  I can't speak to the coffee, but obviously Yelpers are pretty high on that here.  I would imagine the Brophy\/Xavier\/Central High students probably frequent this place regularly.  And yes I'm a little bummed this place wasn't around when I was a student across the street.
Nice, chill, cozy sometimes a bit overcrowded but enjoy their coffee and nice treatment by the staff.

One of my favorite hangouts in Central PHX. Always busy and happening, so I'd definitely find a spot to sit before you order. I often come alone, and I've never worried about my computer\/belongings getting stolen; all of the other hipsters there already have a macbook covered in stickers.
My drink recommendation: hibiscus lemonade-delicious and tart! it's a pretty color too
I love coming here with friends and just hanging out or playing a round or two of bananagrams or cards against humanity. They always have good music playing and something interesting on the TV in the back room. Overall, I think Lux is the perfect place to get out of the house\/office and get some work done during the day or have a quiet night out with friends.

Every time my boyfriend and I go to Lux we get great coffee and have the best conversations.  Part of it is the atmosphere and the fact that we go early in the morning but we always end up staying for 2 hours just enjoying each other and dreaming big dreams.
 
So this place is gets a cheers from me !
Amazing atmosphere and a great cup of joe.  The food is uniquely amazing and always get in and out in a timely manner.  Really is the best coffee shop in Phoenix.

One of my favorite spots in town, great craft cocktails and coffee drinks with good selections of food and goodies, its a bit of a hidden gem no sign from the street, lots of people studying and drinking ample amounts of coffee gives a good vibe to get inspired, I can hang at this place all day long from coffee to drinks in the evening.
This place is my favorite coffee spot in Phoenix. It's also pretty cool you can get alcohol here if you want as well.  Also their Mac and Cheese is to die for ._.

Loved this place!  Sammy is the consummate professional.  Only had a wonderful blackberry shot...but, already have plans on next time: The Last Word (watched presentation next to us and awesome), Mac n Cheese with Bacon\/Jalapeño, and the Black & White coffee.

Lux was pretty hard to find at night. The place isn't well lit from the outside and I could not find any large signs to locate this place easily. The parking lot is small and is located at he back so you'll be entering through the back. There are two fairly large dips going from the street to the parking and back to the street so lowered cars should park on the street. It was even hard to clear with a standard car going at parking speed. 

The place was packed with lots of students when I visited. There were no empty tables or seats. The line for drinks was about 6 ppl deep but it moved fast. This place serves a wide variety of food and drinks from coffee to wine and from cakes\/pastries to cooked meals. This place is a one stop wonder. Get your breakfast lunch or dinner at the same spot.  The handcrafted coffee drinks selection is bigger than many places so you get lots of interesting choices. I had the velvet latte drink in a large size. I love the fact that you can pick larger sizes for a little bit more as opposed to other shops who don't give you that option. The velvet was fairly sweet tasting. I think it'll be better with a little less sweetness or probably an additional shot in this drink would do the trick. The drink tasted ok, not among the best lattes I've had but it was good enough. 

3 stars for the drink, 1 star for parking, 5 stars for a wide variety of offerings, and 5 stars for opening real real late. No other places gives you high quality coffee at midnight. Overall 4 stars.

A very hip place. 

Always crowded. I enjoy the scene. I am not so sure about the new location. It is nice but the cozy vibe has dissipated. They do serve alcohol now but have a very limited (and strange) selection of beers. Cans of Pabst Blue Ribbon. No imports. Strange selection. 

I would have given the old location a 4\/5 star but it just does not feel the same.

Lux is a unique coffee experience. It is very trendy and busy and filled with lots of people of all ages doing all sorts of things ranging from writing novels to playing games to chatting with each other. There are lots of rooms to be in and lots of seating arrangements. They also host various meet up groups including a writers group which is what brought me to Lux for the first time. It is a cool place and you'll feel cool if you go there. And by the way, the coffee and the pastries are wonderful!

The best lattes I ever had.   I usually go to Dutch bros because they have a drive thru.  But, honesty if I could I would rather stop here.  You can tell it's the best when you can't find parking lol.   If I wasn't a busy mommy this would be my to go.

Went to Lux for the first time yesterday to grab a hot tea and get some work done. Overall, it was a great experience and I am looking forward to returning. The people who work there are pretty cool, they made me a couple great big mugs of hot tea and I had a crazy amazing brioche with huge chunks of sweet apples. awwww yeahhhh!

I would give it 5 stars but it is a bit on the pricey side, the atmosphere could be better and there are NO seats at lunchtime. I was standing around for a good 15 minutes like a jerk with my laptop waiting for someone to leave. It seems like they might be able to make more room but its hard to say what the rest of the building is used for. 

At any rate, the best thing about this place isn't the place, or even the coffee and food- its the people. The employees are friendly and funny and the patrons are really, really cool. I met 2 people there I knew from Twitter who introduced me to another friend, who in turn introduced me to yet another person. There is a great buzz in this place, lots of people thinking, working and talking all fueled by caffeine. I had a ton of great conversation and thoroughly enjoyed myself. Looking forward to returning.

I can't even begin to describe my love for Lux. I'm fortunate enough to live walking distance from there and it has become something like a second home. It's a coffee shop mixed with a wine bar, what more could you possibly ask for in one place?

Yes, parking is crazy, and yes, it is always packed, but once you find a seat, you often get lost in the people watching and the free iced tea refills and end up spending hours there. The reason it's always so packed is because the desserts are divine, as well as the breakfast, lunch, and dinner they make. Not to mention iced coffee refills are only $1. I've never not enjoyed whatever I've ordered there.

I've always noticed great service from the employees. Whenever I bring my cup back for a fifth or sixth refill of hibiscus iced tea (it's somewhat of an addiction), they gladly refill it for me. Although it's always packed and there's typically always a line, the employees keep their cool and try to serve everyone in a timely manner.

Whether you're looking for a place to meet with a friend, to study, to do work, or just to decompress after a long day, Lux is the place to go. I'd give it six stars if I could (mostly because free iced tea refills are awesome).

Oh my God... Where the heck did this hipster haven come from -- and in Phoenix of all places! Seriously, Polaroids on the wall, mason jar glasses and lots of bespectacled patrons.

I saw just how many Yelp reviews Lux had and had to lay my preconceived notions about people from Phoenix and their snobbish ways aside (I'm from Tucson, can you blame me? We're all a bunch of dirty hippies in Baja Arizona). I stopped in on a recent trip up to Phoenix and enjoyed a croissant and a latte. 

I was immediately impressed with the vibe (wait, did I just use the word vibe... I think I did), even though I was a little surprised by it's location -- there's not much around it at all. Great music, great art and a laid back atmosphere that's conducive to just hanging out or perhaps writing the next great American novel.

The croissant was to die for, and the coffee was perfect -- apparently roasted on site.

I sat at the juice bar and watched an impressively mustached man create some very interesting drinks. I didn't stick around long, but I liked what I saw. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.

The only reason I didn't go ahead and give the full five stars was the initial frustration I had when ordering -- I'm no idiot, but the process wasn't intuitive and none of the staff seemed interested in helping me out. They were too busy updating their Instagram and talking about the next greatest band you've never heard of. That sort of bummed me out, but the yummy coffee soon made up for it.

Great "hidden" place! 

My wife and I go to Lux every other weekend to get breakfast and coffee! They serve the best breakfast and lattes in downtown Phoenix in our opinion! 

And even though we mostly go there for breakfast this week we stop by to eat dinner and what I had was amazing! A burger on an English muffin that was perfect. For dinner they always change the menu, but I wish they made that burger a constant in their menu!

Wow! An incredible place! Full of delicious homemade pastries and quiche. The coffee is excellent and the atmosphere is uniquely casual comfortable and friendly. Customers are conversational, smiling and quite content. There's an open bar, separate areas for computing, reading or meeting. This was my first time in Phoenix  My friend is fortunate enough to be in walking distance. Her boxer holds court at Lux engaging young and old alike.

While at a conference downtown I hopped on a GridBike and road the 5 miles to give this place a try.  The place was surprisingly full for a Tuesday night.  I had asked for a cocktail menu which they don't have, but the bartender was true mixologist.  

She made me a wiskey cocktail the was perfect.  This is where I lack the vocabulary to properly describe the drink but it was just as I requested.  Alcohol forward not too sweet.  Without measuring or testing it she made a well balanced cocktail wirh no one ingredient overpowering any other.

We'll worth the pedal.  Should have had another and Ubered back.
I live nowhere near Lux but it is worth the trip. Their lattes are fantastic!
Love this place! Great laid back atmosphere and service is superb! I recommend ANY of their bakery goods. Haven't had a bad one yet!
Cute little spot in Central Phoenix. The coffee and lattes are amazing. The baked goods are good but nothing special.

Totally worth the drive from Scottsdale. The food is delicious, and is not pre-packaged, such a nice change for a coffee joint. Support local business, Starbucks has nothing on Lux; other than a million locations. Keeping the service consistent would help. Sometimes it's stellar sometimes it's horrid. Guess it depends on how their day is going. Still was in 3 times today #shameless

Latte was good. Latte art was meh-
Lemonade was good.
Good place to chit-chat inside or out on the patio.

I'm being generous with the 3 stars simply because the coffee was great. Perfect flavor, perfect amount of froth. The atmosphere, however; was unimpressive. We came here on a Sunday evening and I felt like I was in Tempe. It's a college hangout, to say the least. We sat outside to get away from the noise, only to be surrounded by obnoxious conversations outside. Also, my girlfriend asked for a glass of dry Cabernet...they gave her a red blend that tasted like Arbor Mist. 

We expected a mature atmosphere based on the website and reviews. Clearly that's not the case. 

If you're early college age, you'll probably love it. Otherwise, get your coffee to go.

This place is awesome.  I've been here no less than 50 times in the last couple years.  It's great for getting a beer\/cocktail, great for dinner, great for lunch, and they have amazing\/quick breakfast options.  I sometimes work from here for half a day on the free\/fast wifi (there's plenty of power outlets in the back room area.  Highly recommend this place.  Well done, Jeff Fischer!
Great coffee, friendly folks, tasty brekky (only meal I've had there) and a cool little bar area in back serving well made cocktails. What more do you need!?
Upon Entering the Establishment I was lost and Confused the Staff looked at me walked around Didn't offer any help or serve me would not recommend

love the morning coffee.... great selection of morning pastry and breakfast selection .  
the staff is awesome and friendly and could not more more helpful !  
Great service Lux !

Its a coffee place.
Its a bar.
Its a date place.
Its a study lounge.

LOVE. LOVE LOVE LOVE.

If you are a coffee drinker this place is for you. if you aren't about that.. it may be hard to navigate because they don't really have a menu. its more like you tell them they can make it. They are real Baristas. No posers here.. real hipsters!

Awesome cafe!
I have loved everything I've ordered from here from the drip, straight espresso, to the mocha. I didn't have a good experience with the chai, but they promptly remade it and it was much better!

Good product, good customer service! 
FANTASTIC atmosphere! I have written many papers here this week.

We met Nicole at a social event where she told us she did Estate Planning.  At age 51, I still had none of my assets secured.  Nicole offered a free 30 minute consultation which was tremendously educational.  She went on to create our trust, will, power of attorney, and various other documents.  She even went the extra step of creating us an LLC and helping to transfer our assets accordingly.  She was so thorough, and explained every step along the way.  She counseled us on the pros and cons of each decision, gave us homework, and guided us over the finish line with every part of the estate planning.  She completely exceeded our expectations.  I could not recommend her more highly!!

I was skeptical at first when I came in and didn't see many vegan options. I only had one item to choose from on the dinner menu--a sweet potato curry soup. Fortunately, it was delicious. My soy raspberry vanilla iced latte was superb. They had one vegan baked good--a maple doughnut--which was nice. At least they have a few options out there. But the real treat was the bar. The bartender was friendly, well-informed, extremely knowledgeable about the alcohol on hand, and open to whatever creative drink you could throw his way. I got a balsamic bloody mary and it was divine. All you had to do was give him some ideas and he took them and ran. Would definitely consider stopping in here on a night out, especially if all the bartenders are that good.

When I first walk into Luxe I think New York underground. 

Its kind of dark and they're are a lot of people studying. The layout of the store is kind of confusing but over all its a "hip" place. Their espresso drinks are solid but their CHAI??!?!?!? its not sweet.... just warning you.... 

I wish I could have gotten something to eat because they had a whole bakery in there. Its probably a college students dream. 

Overall I'd say : Solid... I'd be a regular. (and I didn't give it a four since I didn't try the food but it may have changed my rating.)
Such a fun and great place to grab a cup of coffee during the day and a cocktail at night. It's always busy and buzzing with a great vibe
Very good, Cartel is better by far.

Face it - modern life can be lonely. And Phoenix can feel like an odd, random place to have landed when you are 58 years old, as I am - how, precisely, did I wind up on the searing desert, and how did it happen to all of these other people who I see sweating on the street? 

At Lux, however, the existential depression shuts off, and its polar opposite flips on - how delightful that we've all come together into this cool, noisy, crowded, friendly, interesting space to have some coffee! If life is indeed random, let's all be randomly happy together! 

I have written parts of two books here, and the energy of Lux is on every page - it's a good place to do the difficult business of writing readable prose.

And no one here is a "hipster," a word that does the world absolutely no good. They are young, for the most part, and enjoying being with their friends in the wonderful, intense, lovely way young people have since the dawn of humanity, and they are doing it a nice place in the middle of an awful, hot, barren desert, because young people are great and resilient and clever and wonderful. Old people are too, for that matter. 

The whole place, the whole thing, is a testimony to just how fantastic people are, from the people who built this place to the people who come here to the people who smile as they hand over your coffee and ask about your day. Relax, smile, enjoy - it's a little easier at Lux, and when you leave, maybe you'll find it easier to do these things elsewhere.

You have to try the velvet!!! Lux is so to die for, we actually had a meeting at my office that it is ok to go during work hours without counting it as a break as long as you bring some back for everyone. (no joke)

de LUX! I come here for one thing and one thing only, Lattes! Alright, fine, I come here for their baked goods as well. An eclectic crowd assembles here drinking their coffee and conversing, or deep in their computers. Lux is a very cool coffee house that you can relax for an hour or so or grab a joe and go. Definitely one of the top 5 coffee houses in PHX!!
The place is just awesome.  Great service and nice atmosphere. It has such a unique arrangement of the chairs and tables.  It is a hip place even for an old guy like me.

Say what you will about the overwhelming amount of goofy hipsters at this place, but out of all the breakfasts I've had in the valley, this is my favorite. I get the two eggs\/hashbrowns\/tomatoes and everything is always exceptional. It can be a bit chaotic during peak hours and finding decent seating a challenge, but I am willing to deal with all of this for their delicious food.

Very chill, good coffee, friendly service and fast! Definitely will be returning

For such a big, popular place like this they should be able to afford more than 2 stalls bathroom js

Fun, urban atmosphere.  The coffee drinks are great, but my favorite is the chai latte is my favorite!  The treats and snacks are always good!  Lots of great seating and different areas for getting work done, relaxing with a book, catching up with friends, watching a big game, or falling in love!  My fiance took me here for our first coffee\/tea date, and we have a few other friends whose relationship sparked talking over coffee at Lux!!

02.06.10

Is this where all the cool college kids hang out with their shades and their laptops to people-watch?

If not, it should be.

Iced coffee gets the job done.

The restroom stocks fancy products!

The 'N word' is not okay. I must give Lux a failing score from last nights experience. I go there often, and usually have good experiences, but last night was different. While studying in the, what seems to be their quiet room, there was music playing at a fairly low level that was different from what was playing out in the main areas. The sound level of the music playing wasn't the problem, but the words being used by the artist were. One of the artists songs repeatedly used the 'N word'. Lux MUST be more responsible about what they play at their establishment. I am truly hoping that it was a one time mistake.

Eh?  A little too hipster for me.........2.5 stars! 

I had been to Pane Bianco about a dozen or so times, and had never walked next door to Lux.  The other day, I decided to check it out.  I needed some caffeine and an iced coffee sounded good.  

I walked next door, got in line and placed my order for an iced coffee.  My total was $4.50.  Meh.  A bit small of an iced coffee for $4.50.  I know its "higher quality" made by an "artisan", but I much prefer my Dunkin Donuts iced coffee for under $2.00.  They give you your cup, and then you have to cream and sugar it yourself at their little table.  The coffee was pretty tasty, but it was skimp.  I took about 5 or 6 good strawfuls, and it was pretty much gone.  

The service was friendly enough, and the joint is ALWAYS packed.  It's a bit too fancy\/hipster for my liking though and I don't think I am coming back.

Holy Smokes! This place sets the bar high for what is cool. Any other establishment would be suffering from a major identity crisis if they tried to simultaneously function as a coffee shop, bakery, restaurant, and bar but Lux somehow does it all and does it right! If you are someone who likes working at a table with strangers (as most tables or couches will be full by the time you get there), loud music and the temptation to drink booze rather than coffee, Lux is the place for you!!

I love showing my friends from out of town this place in hopes they will fall in love with Lux, quit their jobs, leave their families and move into Phoenix!

Personally, I am nowheres cool enough to hangout here on a regular basis. The DJ plays his music too loud, I can never find an open table, and I always fall a fool to the temptation of to sipping down the nectar of me people, Templeton Rye. Iowa Represent!! But even with all that up against me, I still stop by at the Lux very so often to remind me how much of a basic b*tch I actually am. LOVE THIS PLACE!
I absolutely love relax! It has this ever been vibe and quiet ambience. Their drinks are delicious and I will keep coming back to this place I recommend.

This place is very trendy and typically crowded. If you're looking for a social interaction or to be left alone, you can do both here! I give it a 4 based on the fact that they are typically out of a lot of food and drink choices(due to being so popular) and I haven't come in contact with a friendly staff member get. All around I enjoy it here and it really does have that coffee shop feel. I love
going here for homework, reading, or writing!
Love, love, Love this place. Great atmosphere and the best coffee i have ever had. trendy place, always busy, open late, variety

So happy to have this spot in my hood. It's one of the first places we checked out when we moved here. I'm a fan of the iced coffee (feels expensive though at $4) and pastries, but look forward to trying a cocktail sometime. We're early birds so it's fantastic that this is open super early every day. I like the décor, especially the huge David Bowie wall art.

Love this place! 

Local, diverse, hip, and most importantly it has the best deserts and Mac and cheese! 

Did I mention that they also have a full bar? Lovely!!! Their mixologist is are awesome! 

I highly recommend it!
Sooooo busy. I could hardly find a place to sit when studying at 9 PM. The baked goods were tasty and I enjoyed my drink, but just be aware it will feel more like a concert than a study space.

What can I say?
 LUX has great coffee and friendly baristas, but as one who is looking for a chill coffee bar to chat, read or study; alas, LUX is not for me. 

 The sweets selection is divine and espresso tasty as all hell. The problem lies in actually getting service since the place is always jam packed. I have on three occasions tried to meet friends to study here (but they all love a loud atmosphere and don't really study, just prop books in front of them in hope the information will fly on a free floating wave length into their brains). Each time I had to excuse myself and go to another spot to study. Maybe if the place were only half as busy?Hmmm, who knows?

Lux is the grande dame of Phoenix coffee houses with wonderful coffee drinks, a nice bar, and a full dinner menu. Dinning there can sometimes be a challenge as the tables occasionally double as the embassy of Laptopistan but the food is first rate. Well worth a visit.

Total hipster hot spot. I'm not a hipster yet I felt comfortable in the shop. The coffee was really good. I also had a pastry and it was superb. It's got a pretty cool vibe and it's a great spot to people watch.

Probably one of my favorite spots in all of Phoenix. I've been coming here since I started school at GCU and it is my favorite place to study and socialize with friends! I always get the iced black and white and it is nothing short of a treat! Highly recommend to anybody.

It doesn't matter if you're going there for the coffee, the food, the cocktails or just for the vibe... You will be amazed by all. This is a great place for people new to Phoenix or for someone just in town for the weekend.

Great coffee house with all the fixings including coconut milk, almond etc. and very gluten friendly . . . However let's chat about their cocktails with fresh squeezed juices and garden fresh ingredients . . .simply fierce mixology! And then there is the jalapeño Mac and Cheese! YUM!  Top it all off with the fresh sweets and you have simple perfection. This is not for the healthy conscious seeker however splurge and enjoy the best naughty of all the drink and food pleasure!  Always a great late afternoon hot spot to finish out some work and wind down.  The staff are top notch!

One of the leaders of coffee in Phoenix is Lux. What's amazing: the coffee, the espresso, the baked goods, and the location. The service is always good, but there is little time for chatting because the line is long. What can be a drag is that it's busy all the time, but it's not a fault.

Favorite coffee shop ever! Such an amazing energy, atmosphere! They make homemade whipped creme and their Vanilla Latte with almond milk AMAZING! The atmosphere is like no other! The Kale Salad was also delicious!
Just read my tip, and realize the only reason to bring someone here is so they can see what happens when you have a great concept and NO IDEA how to execute properly.

Delicious food and coffee! We had the Egg Sandwich, add sausage for perfection! I ordered the dutch pancake, topped with a variety of tasty fruits. my son and I enjoyed! Large variety of desserts, coffee and hand crafted cocktails that really caters to anyone. Loved the rustic cafe look and decor inside. A unique experience from your typical Starbucks Coffee shops, which is exactly what we were looking for. Music was nice, and the staff was friendly. Overall we enjoyed the experience. A little crowded for my taste, with not many tables to sit a family\/child.
Amazing little coffee joint. I came here on a brunch date with some friends a few years ago and fell in love with their caramel latte. The quality is great! Worth a visit!  Amazing atmosphere!

Ancestry.com is a RIP OFF ! They say free trial and after 3 days I had to cancel. My computer has windowsxp and I couldn't view any documents. So I tried to cancel online but the drop down for reason why didn't work. I called and Bill told me I didn't sign up for the free trial period THAT'S A LIE. They they still kept my money  I just want everyone to know there is no such thing a free trail.

Love this place morning and night!

They have some of the most delicious pastries and breakfast, not to mention their lattes! I love to get a honey latte early in the morning. 

Went here the other night for the first time to check out their cocktails and it was a little strange at first to order cocktails without a menu but the staff there ask you what types of drinks you like and then just make something for you. I had two cocktails, one called the grapefruit (the had absolutely no grapefruit in it.. but tasted just like it!) the second cocktail was a mixed berry mojito, both were very tasty. The jalapeno mac was outstanding as well. Can't wait to go back.

Opening night!  The food was fantastic.  Same great pastries and coffee\/teas as Lux. But now with wine and food.  Had a great time.  Ambiance is fantastic.  There are two work\/study areas and a large dining area.  Service was great.  Good selection of beers and wines.  Great addition to the coffee shop.  Extended hours - so for all you night owls it's fantastic.  Hope to spend more time here!

Overpriced with fair food. My tea was good and the atmosphere was great but my wife's coffee was just far too bitter for iced coffee. In general, the location seemed disorganized to me. Baked goods were fair, but nothing better than what we could obtain at starbucks for a cheaper price.

i like lux- there's something about getting my foam in the shape of a leaf that makes me giggly and feel fancy. i also think it's cool that they have a bar but other than that, i can take it or leave it. there's not enough seating and why am i going to sit ouside all year if i can't smoke? i know that's my issue but there are plenty of other coffee shops in phoenix and tempe that have impressed me with their actual drinks and atmosphere
Good coffee and good atmosphere.  Ironically pretentious clientele.
Very cool establishment.  Service is quick and pleasant. Food is amazing although the portions seem to be getting smaller.

Great coffee, I recommend the excellent Yorkshire pudding burger that is steady on a daily changing evening menu.  Cool atmosphere (multiple rooms with tables\/chairs) with free wifi - when you need to spend some time doing research or work.  I've been able to catch parts of a game on the large screen room (just a plus).  Its usually crowded with a never ending amazing mix of people - so if you like to be "alone" - maybe not your place.  An unusual mix of music - which I enjoy.  Nice outdoor seating as well.  Parking can be limited, though can park down the street.

Great spot for brunch, gets pretty busy if you're not there early on the weekends.  Aunt Gladys plate was delicious, the biscuits in gravy looked great as well.  Would definitely revisit when I'm in town next.
missing 5 stars because they don't have raw sugar for my coffee
Awesome atmosphere and food. Always a big crowd which is testament to its greatness. I had a mocha and 2 eggs\/bacon\/hash. Nice place to study, work or just hang out.

Seriously the best! Lots of room and outlets for your devices to charge.
Great selection of teas, coffee, and pastries.. I think they have other food stuffs.. But had just had dinner and wasn't hungry but for a snack..
Great atmosphere.. I have never been to a coffee joint that had such a mixed crowd.. From young college students to high schoolers... To 70 year olds with canes, to on duty, off duty officers, professionals, students. Whatever you guys are doing at Lux keep it up.. A very welcoming place and a very come together and be comfy place.
If I lived in Phoenix I would be here everyday.

I love Lux, and now that I've left downtown Phoenix living for good, I will miss it.

I am going to give it five stars instead of four, because Jeff, the owner, more than makes up for the crowds with his great customer service. He gets to know his regulars by name and encourages all of the staff to do the same. 

To the reviewer who was bummed out that they didn't know what a "cafe ole" was... I think you MEANT "cafe au lait." It's a French drink, not a Spanish cheer.

Yeah it's crowded. Yeah there are often too many hipsters (my little sister said that she'd have to find some Buddy Holly glasses to wear in next time, so she'd fit in better). But the coffee is great, the baked goods are awesome, and the staff is capable, courteous, and kicks much ass.

WE WANT LATTE ART! 

My sister Jannette L. and I have been on a coffee shop kick lately and she digs latte art, so we were recommended to come here! Hearing that it has a lot of great tasting options we decided to come here. 

I must say it was quite hard to find since we didn't see any logos or anything that suggested this building was Lux, we kinda went in blind. 

Coming in, you definitely get the hipster vibe, which is cool, everything is esthetically pleasing, the atmosphere is chill, just meant for you to relax. I dig it. 

Coming up to the counter, the gentleman was nice and made sure to greet us, we ordered 2 Ghirardelli hot chocolates (yum) and a vanilla latte (also yum). We picked up 2 cup cakes as well, vanilla vanilla and chocolate espresso. The barista  got my friends hot chocolate wrong, whole milk instead of almond -1 star. I saw a peanut butter cake and recommended it to bestie Joyce W. (Queen of PB). So to make sure she asked the cashier if it was peanut butter cake or frosting, the gal replied with "oh, it's peanut butter something". -1 star, woah girl, you should know a little more about your job and customer service. 

The drinks were delightful, keeping us warm as we chit chatted and caught up. The pastries on the other hand, were dry and crumbling to touch. The treat were displayed open on plates behind a glass, no covering or anything preventing them from being exposed to air. I'll say it's fair game that it was 10pm and end of the day so I'll let Lux keep that star. 

It was a fun and popular place to stop by, and try out, but I definitely think I can find another spot with equally delicious drinks, less of a crowd and hopefully better service.

Don't get me wrong I love lux's atmosphere. Love the lighting. Coffee drinks are mediocre at best. I think you go here if you wanna be "in the scene". Make sure bring your white converse jean jacket and or highwaisted shorts. Everyone as soon as you walk in immediately looks up from their MacBooks (that they got with their student loans) pretending to work and look busy. If you don't get lost in the maze of a cafe trying to find the freaking bathroom. The customer service in the evening is really rude.  They don't care what my name is or when I ask question about which tea is the best they give me this snarky look and make me feel like I'm bothering them. There's this one hipster fat black haired vegan who is the ultimate doucher and this skinny blonde who is extra rude. Other then the customer service it's not a bad place. The bathrooms are pretty dope too.

Best almond milk latte ever.  No need for sweet.  Love this place,  for coffee or wine or good local grub.  But what made my day was the apricots! You can keep your spotty, sad bananas, Starbucks!   I'll take 5 apricots,  please.

Fantastic Espresso here.  You can certainly taste how fresh it is.  Aside from the coffee though, the place appears to be over run with "I'm too cool for school" hipsters, tattoos and nose piercings to boot.  I can handle a few dirty pretentious hipsters here and there, but not sure if I need a joint full of 100 of them.  Will be back for the java, but will probably get it to go.

I have been here a handful of times and have yet to recieve great service or any standard of service for that matter. I have no complaints about the coffee or food. The atmosphere is loud and busy but again, no problem with that either. What really bothers me is how rude the staff is. Maybe they don't realize their customers are paying their bills and funding their livelihood. Whatever it is it embarrasses me that the owner allows staff to treat guests as a problem and annoyance. Truly disappointed that my neighborhood coffee shop deters business for their lack of care for customers or service.

Great coffee and awesome environment! Staff is nice and there are a couple of rooms tucked away in the back which are great for studying.

I plan on coming back
Super busy...kind of a cluster-F even..but cool environment.  Food is solid.  Expresso is very...bold.

What a cute spot! This place is very unique and has a hipster vibe. The employees were very friendly and accommodating. I got an iced black and white with the homemade espresso whipped cream which was so yummy I felt sad once I drank it all! First, I said no to whipped cream, but when I saw how good it looked and was told it's homemade I was sold! I also got a croissant and two slices of their bacon which was awesome. This is a great place, so glad I went!

This place is a bonafide treasure for Phoenix.  If you are looking for authentic, urban and high quality coffee experience this place is for you.
