The owner is ALWAYS there and will go out of his way to say hello and treat you like family.  This place is unique enough in that its a true melting pot - gathering place for many demographics.  Pastries were all made from scratch and the vibe is WAY better than corporate competitors.  Keep it up.

Love Lux. Great place to go for some coffee & chill with friends. Usually busy so plan to parallel park on the street (free) but luckily there's usually a seat available. If you're coming with more than 3-4 people plan to search for a seat. Free wifi & hipster-gazing. Also has food.

I've been coming here whenever I'm on this side of town, for years.  We all know the coffee and sweets are great but my real reason for writing is that I started eating the food recently... and it's phenomenal.  Obviously, not a huge menu, but there are only a few places in town that make really great inventive salads, and I'm kind of a snob.  I don't need a lot of choices as long as they're all good.  I have had 2 salads at Lux now and both of them were THE BEST.   My friend had the steak and it was better than the one he had ordered a couple nights prior at a steakhouse.  Almost silly. 

PS. 
I've got quite possibly the lamest (non existent) sense of style ever, but I'm not sure what people are talking about when they speak of "hipster sneer".  I get it... people who take their hip fashion trends seriously make you uncomfortable.. that's ok... just let them be, I promise that if they're being rude to you it's probably because you seem like a jerk and are giving off a bad vibe, not because they are super angry that you would step foot into their favorite establishment.  Like I said, my style sucks, and I go there all the time.  Stop caring so much what people seem to think of you.
Super cute and the quiche is scrumptious. Went for a layover, not too far from downtown and fell in love with the awesome vibe. If ever I'm in Phoenix, I'll be coming back for sure!

spacious and interesting interior; I liked the ambience more than anything. There were people studying, getting a mid-day drink, hanging out with friends, etc. I ordered a tea and coffee and both were decent. I also like that there is a variety of baked goods. I thought the ripped couch thing was quite tacky and came off as trying too hard to be hipster, so that is one of the parts of coming here I didn't like. Overall, I would recommend this place to a friend.

This is a great little "internet" cafe\/bar\/restaurant, conveniently located in Central Phoenix. Good food, pastries\/desserts and drinks. If you want a "local" alternative to Starbucks, this is a very nice option.

They are legendary and everyone in the local coffee scene is aware of this place. Food is great, coffee is good, and this is what makes Lux special. 

Finding this place can be a bit tasking for first-timers as it is easy to miss. When you do find the place, parking just adds on more stress. The place itself is always exceptionally busy, so expect a wait time to order. The good thing is they stay on top of things so it's not too bad. 

The cool parts: They serve alcohol. Food is fresh. Did I mention they serve alcohol? Also they are open till 2a for all those NIGHT RIDERS!!! (I am the Night Rider!!) 

The off putting parts: The place is busy which means finding a table can be impossible at times (including the back area). My biggest critique goes to their music. Their "background music" is obnoxiously loud. It feels like you're at a club and that is disappointing for a place like this. I go here to enjoy good food, coffee, and even conversation. Turning it a bit down is all I ask. This may be just a personal quibble, but that's what I feel bothers me the most.

Overall this is a fantastic place, and you haven't lived unless you've came here for breakfast!! :)

Great place to hang out with friends or even study. I didn't try any of their foods, but it definitely smelled delicious! It was a little somewhat pricey though, and when I had gone (noonish on Friday) it was very packed and hard to find a seat. But honestly it's worth it. There's a great environment about this place. Would definitely recommend!

Was introduced to this place by a friend, it seems as though this is where you can find all the hipsters of Arizona. :P

I do have to admit their coffee is damn good.  Two times I've been here I've had the cappuccino and it's been great.  The second time I went, I took some "Starbucks" drinkers and they enjoyed their cappuccinos straight up; sans a gallon of syrup and chocolate sauce.

I used to love this place before it became so popular :\/ now it's overrated. Still an okay place to catch up on homework when it's not super packed. One things for sure is that their mac & cheese is still mouthwatering delicious!

Consistently excellent coffee! Line is almost always long, but moves quickly and is very much worth it. I highly recommend grabbing either a jalapeno cheddar scone or muffin if they have them out. For those craving a rare cocktail, sit at the bar and have the bartender make you something fancy. I recommend a Rimbaud's Left Hand.
Surprisingly lives up to all the hype. Food was delicious and coffee was even better. I liked the unpretentious atmosphere and community tables.

Coffee is on point! Super hyped on their espresso. Can't get enough of the salted chocolate chip cookies. I need a Keebler elf to deliver them to my house. People watching is amazing. I could be a fly on the wall there for hours. I've never seen so much thought go into ones outfit but hey, if you don't look good the food and drink won't taste good. ;)

I have no complaints for this place. They have ruined me for coffee anywhere else, they're so delicious. I have yet to try the food, but I have heard great things from many people. I had the Velvet and they can serve to go or in a ceramic coffee cup to stay. They had a cute design waiting for me. The line setup was confusing, but I eventually figured it out. They have delicious looking desserts that I must try next time in! They have a lot of outdoor seating, a good amount of indoor but it's always so packed. The parking isn't too big of an issue unless it's super busy. There's a small parking lot and street parking as far as I know, so goodluck!! A must try - great ambiance, great coffee, very hipster, friendly staff, clean restroom, and somewhat hidden in the rear entrance :)

The drinks and food a Lux are really good (lattes! house-made donuts!), but I definitely don't go there for the service. The employees are never friendly. Not a "hello," not a "thank you," not even eye contact, half the time. The least you can do is pretend that you appreciate my patronage. Or that you, ya know, see me.

Lux is my favorite place to go drink a coffee, enjoy a fresh pastry and write away on my computer. It has a pretty retro-Hipstery feel to it. I've been going here since I was in High school, since it was across the street from my school, ha! Love it.

Great coffee, food, and pastries. I really like this place. It is always packed though, so expect to look for seating. They even have a nice craft beer selection. This is a great coffee shop for hanging out, but I might not study here due to how packed it gets.

come on, more then 200+ reviews and almost everyone loves it.  Stop debating and give the place a try, you won't be disappointed. The coffee is great, the whip cream doesn't come out of a spray nozzle and the atmosphere is very lax, just how a coffee shop should be.

I recommend the Velvet mocha if you're like me and like your coffee to taste like a dessert.

I have liked Lux the most of all the coffee shops I've tried in Phoenix so far.  I should have gone here months ago!  It was just lovely on a July day.  Interior has a fantastic, simple feel.  The temperature was refreshing.  My iced chai latte was delicious.

I'm going to change that to five stars.  :)

Been going to Grassroots in Scottsdale since they opened. Food has become inconsistent, wine pours are short & pricy, cocktails are all shaved ice, & what passes for background music is nothing but noise. Owner needs to spend more time there & get his act together. There are lots of better places in the area to spend your hard earned dollars.
The honey latte is amazing! The atmosphere is a bit too hipster for this dad...but the java keeps me coming back whenever I'm in town!

I don't drink coffee but my husband said it was great.  I had a breakfast sandwich that was pretty good and my husband had a blueberry muffin.  I like the idea behind the seating and cafe but it was easy to feel like an outsider.  I would like to go back again and try some of their other baked goods that looked delicious.

If you look up the antonym to hipster you will find my photo.
We were referred here by our awesome waiter Matt at the Henry for drinks. 
It was a Saturday night, about 10 pm and my boyfriend and I went dressed up (NY standard, not PHX standards) like we usually are to go out and needless to say the minute we stepped foot inside I felt a little out of place. But we forged through the coffee area to the back bar area. We found two cozy seats and were greeted. I have to say although I look very different then anyone working there and most people going there they were all very nice to us and helpful (which I cannot say of all "hipster joints" *cough* Cartel *Cough*). 
If you like a great cocktail and even to challenge your palate, You HAVE to go hear! They have all quality liquors and mixers and to make it even better, there is NO cocktail menu. They can make all the classics, but the fun part is telling them what you like and don't like in a drink and they will create fabulous concoction just for you! I am talking rose water, lavender, all kinds of herbs and unique flavor profiles and combinations. To make it better, the prices are reasonable! To get a fabulous hand-made cocktail with all top shelf and beyond liquors for $8-$10 is a great deal and  they don't use ice and "fillers" to cut you short, with a couple drinks you will feel, let's say, relaxed...
Now the Mac-n-cheese with Bacon and Jalapenos!!! YES! It is perfect. Great comfort food, you may feel guilty for having consumed all that fat BUT it is totally worth it and you will love every moment of it!
Their baked goods and coffee are also great.
The music however... I have been there when they played the whole collection of Metallica (Lord, help me)... It isn't always that awful, however I don't care for the music most restaurants play today, so I digress. 
I have already brought a few people and suggested it to a few others.... this is a must try!
I tell you what, hipsters know their cocktails, coffee and food.

My fiancé and I have been loyal Lux customers for sometime now. While out shooting some engagement footage for our upcoming wedding we decided to stop in get some coffee and maybe a clip or two of us in Lux since it has been one our fave date places in the past. Upon sitting down the owner abruptly came over to our table in a very rude fashion and informed us that this was His property. Very sarcastically asked our videographer if he was professional. And basically gave us the boot.  We would have totally been willing to put the camera away if he had been even slightly courteous. There coffee quality pails in comparison to cartel but in the past we thought it was a chill atmosphere. Needless to say we will no longer be fans of Lux. Viva Cartel!

A big thanks to "EPIC POOL SERVICE & REPAIR LLC" in Gilbert, for outstanding service and repair. After I discovered my pool pump was leaking, I called a pool service (Elite Pool Management) to come and fix the problem. Two days later and after several calls and voice messages with no response, I found Epic  Pool Service & Repair LLC on Yelp. Joe came out that day to inspect the pump (at no charge) to see what model and parts he might need to do the repair. He also explained what the problem might be and what could possibly be involved to fix it. He gave me a high estimate of the worse case scenario and a low estimate of a minor repair. That was on a Wednesday. Joe said he would be back on Friday morning at the very latest. Joe called the next day to inform me that he had the parts and would be there Friday morning. As promised he and a co-worker were at my house at 7 am. It took them less than an hour to fix the pump. I was very pleased when I was charged the low estimate and told my pump still had a long life ahead. Great doing business with them. I found EPIC POOL SERVICE & REPAIR LLC to be honest, professional and would highly reccommend them to family and friends.

A couple weeks before a recent trip to Phoenix, I saw a picture of a delicious-looking Bloody Mary somebody posted on Facebook. I saw that it came from a place called Lux Central in Phoenix, and when I looked it up on Yelp I noted its strong reviews and determined to eat there when I was in town. I dragged my husband across town with promises of brunch, not realizing the place was more of a coffee shop with food and booze than an actual restaurant.

We walked in and took a lap around the space, noting the lack of tables, and the near absence of available chairs. I don't think I've ever seen so many people with laptops in a coffee shop all at once, and I hail from L.A., land of the Starbucks screenplay. I liked the vibe of the place--pretty hip, even strikingly hipster, especially by Phoenix standards. Eclectic furniture, lots of art on the walls. There was a register for coffee, pastries, and hot food, and a separate bar in the back. We were looking to have more of a sit-down brunch, and actually left to go to Pane Bianco instead, only to find that there wasn't much for my picky husband to eat (no pizza at lunch). We circled back and ordered food and cocktails at the bar, then seated ourselves at a communal table.

Service, at least, was excellent. Our bartender, a young dude with blondish hair, acted as our waiter, too--wish I'd gotten his name, because he was helpful and friendly and generally wonderful. He ordered our food for us and brought it out, along with our drinks. He also made fantastic cocktails. I got my Bloody Mary and it was totally worth the journey. I have no idea what went into it, but it was spicy and flavorful, with depth and complexity, an umami bomb of a Bloody Mary in a mason jar with salt-frosted rim. Didn't hurt that it came garnished with pickled asparagus, green bean, and carrot, along with jalapeño slices and a fistful of candied bacon--out of control delicious. There was no cocktail menu, but our bartender asked what my husband was in the mood for, and fixed him a beautiful, balanced Aviation--a lavender-colored cocktail with gin, creme de violette, maraschino liqueur, and lemon juice, garnished with a fancy cocktail cherry.

The food was less exciting, but serviceable enough. I had Aunt Ida's Biscuits and Gravy. The biscuits were buttery with a nice crumble, and I liked the hearty sausage gravy. My husband got some toast with butter and jam, and supplemented that with a croissant. He wasn't particularly impressed with any of it.

I wouldn't necessarily recommend Lux Central for its food, but it's a cool coffee shop with a knockout bar. I'd love to come back for another round of drinks next time I'm in Phoenix. I just wouldn't show up looking for a sit-down meal on an empty stomach.

Awesome latte! I ordered the iced Black and White latte which is basically dark and white chocolate topped with their house made whipped cream. Delicious! Didnt go there for their breakfast or baked goods but everything looked good. It's a small place so i imagine it can get even more crowded than how it was when we went there.
Great everything! Love the pasrtries, the coffee, the people, great, just great!

I'm sure many are lux coffeebar converts and fans... but I've just recently discovered this little gem. I haven't tried many of the food selections but the lattes are to die for, the music is awesome, the ambiance is delightful and the barristas are eye candy! what more can a girl ask for??
My new favorite spot in PHX. Lux you have everything right..cute, cozy, drinks & food are so perfect. I love it here and wouldn't change a thing

I really debated between a 2-star, 3-star, or 4-star.  If this based soley on their coffee drinks then they would be a 4, if based on their pastries a 3, and if based on their non-coffee drinks (ie chai, apple cider) then it would be a 2.

The espresso machiattos are extremely tasty.  I usually end up leaving with quite a good buzz because I'll get a few doubles.  The customers can be kind of bothersome with their macbook pro's staring at you as you try to find a seat, but all in all, I think this place is pretty ok.

Spent the 2013 holidays in sunny Phoenix with my family, and was very happy to take Yelpers up on their recommendation to stop by Lux for lunch. I love the layout and aesthetic of the place (imagine boho chic: reclaimed wood tables, fresh flowers, original framed art, vintage porcelain plate and dishware, and surprisingly comfy modern artsy chairs & sofas).

On the flip side, I also saw Lux through the eyes of my family (including two immigrant Chinese parents and two self-described 'yuppies') which gave me quotable perspective on what it's like to lunch here when you're *not* at all affiliated with the Pabst-drinking, Godard-quoting population. Some notable quotes from the familia, for whom eating at Lux was basically a sociological adventure: 

"Why does everyone here have beards??"
"How can so many dirty people with long hair and tattoos afford to eat here?"
"How come everyone has a Mac? Aren't those expensive??"
"Why are we drinking out of mason jars?"

Truth.

That being said, I personally loved the atmosphere. As a traveler, Lux immediately colors my impression of Phoenix as very liveable and lovable. Because it's popular, it's quite crowded, and the hip hop is a few decibels too loud for my taste, but the space is well-divided into quiet study areas, dining areas, and hangout areas. There are also tons of great children's books to keep your young ones happy. Lux is not kid-friendly in the sense that there are tons of baristas speed-walking around, and it could be a danger zone for coffee spills... but my nieces had a great time occupying a couch, scarfing down mac 'n cheese, playing with their toys and reading books.

The lunch items and pastries were delicious- freshly baked and\/or cooked from high quality, well-selected ingredients. We had a godly pecan bar, a mixed berry corn muffin, bread pudding with fresh whipped cream, NY strip steak and baby arugula on grilled levain, the aforementioned mac 'n cheese, and a chai spice cookie, courtesy of the sweet barista who threw it in gratis, alongside my order for a dirty chai latte.

In short, how can you not love a place whose baristas will slip you free cookies? I miss Lux already.
Always busy and narrow entrance causes line to be in a very bad place, foot traffic doesn't move well. Coffee is ok.

Still love the coffee. 

For the first time ever, I order my coffee and something sweet - for there. While in line, I eyed the sweets. I wasn't the only one, though. A little fly was having his fair share of sugar, flying from scone to muffin to cake. My heart dropped. Luckily, they had a few choices covered up in glass. I chose the massive, super-chocolate walnut brownie. 

Somehow, miraculously, I managed to carry two plates to the "coffee condiment station." I set the brownie down gingerly on the napkins. Then I balanced the coffee cup and saucer in my left hand.... while pouring cream slowly into the cup with my right. I made it almost to the door, when I decided to set the brownie plate down and sip the coffee below the rim - before it sloshed all over the place. It was a suspenseful, long walk and I didn't have a clue how I was going to turn the door handle and make it outside. I stepped aside and asked the people behind me to give me a hand. I don't think they heard me, but they held the door open long enough for me to slip outside... and into a wooden bench directly under the noon-hour sun. Wowza. 

Since it's always so hard to find a spot inside, I opted for out. My brownie began to melt. The hot coffee tasted great, but it did little to save me from the heat and the sweat beginning to collect down my spine. 

Needless to say, I tossed the coffee back like it was a cheap shot at a club, stuffed my brownie in the to-go bag I requested and practically jogged to my car, where I blasted the A\/C and drove away.

Upside of all this? I sliced my brownie into small pieces and shared it with my co-workers, who have not yet been to Lux, although I keep telling them to go... Looks like I brought Lux to them.

Lux serves great coffee. The staff is a little iffy - sometimes tending to be impersonal or even rude. But I have also had some great staff experiences there.

Usually Lux is busy, so good luck finding a seat. The atmosphere inside is great. Local art on their walls is constantly rotating. There are tons of electrical outlets which encourages using their free wifi!

If you go during lunch time do not miss out on stopping next door at Pane Bianco for some of the best sandwiches in Phoenix.

Lux's pastries are good and they offer a verity of specialty bottled drinks. If you're a fan of iced tea try it with mango syrup - it's wonderful and not very many coffee shops I've been to have the mango syrup. It is my personal favorite. Also I love their soy velvet (a soy white mocha). Their smallest size is much smaller than average coffee shops - probably 8 ozs. But it's great if that's what you're looking for. All their lattes come with two shots of espresso, so you're only paying for more milk and syrup when you upsize, so buy according to how much you enjoy the flavor of espresso. 

Their drink prices may seem a little high, but they're worth it. Plus their menu is elegantly designed. Tax is included on the prices listed, which features price points either on the dollar or fifty cent. Purely simple!

LOVE LUX!

This is one of my favorite breakfast and coffee restaurants! My friend and I love coming to LUX catch up and enjoy the atmosphere. The service is great and the drinks\/food is fresh. The first time I ordered the biscuits and gravy with an iced velvet...AMAZING! I haven't been to another breakfast restaurant that makes biscuits and gravy to literally perfection, and I am very critical on biscuits and gravy! The second time I visited Lux I ordered the biscuits and gravy again with a fried egg on top and a hot velvet. Once again...so amazing! While we were eating they were squeezing oranges and the smell encouraged me to get an orange juice to go. And that is how orange juice is supposed to taste! I can't wait to go back for mimosas next!! This is one of my favorite places and I will keep coming back...and so should you! :)

I like Lux too.

(for more detail read the 50-some odd other reviews. Didn't wanna be redundant.)

Fantastic coffee and lots of yummy baked goods. It's become quite a hipster hangout, which has its pluses and negatives. Sometimes it's hard to find a quiet place to work or talk. And parking can be tough on busy weekend mornings. But it's a non-chain Phoenix original, so I'm a fan.

Best cappicino in Phoenix, the artwork is always amazing. But do not ask the barista to make you something that's not on the list or if they have WiFi. Other than that, this place is great. Oh, and the italian toast with blackberry jam..... *starts drooling*

I love LUX's everything! It's a great place to enjoy a cup of coffee, study, or simply just hang out with friends for a chat. Their music and atmosphere is very hip (which I love). I go at least once a week for my fix. I love it here!

I have been here some 3-4 times now...The coffee is very gud though the place just seems too crowded nowadays...Its always a full house so if you are ther on a sat\/sun evening you wont find a place inside...I wish it were a bit quieter and less packed as it is now so that one could enjoy the coffee better...
I have been here multiple times during nursing school and I think it was such a cool place. Pretty good place to study at, depending on the time of day and the ambiance is good.

This is by far my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix. It's got it all: great drinks, good food and an equally cool vibe. I could see some saying that this place is too hipster-ific, but I think it's just fine. It would be hard to get work done in here though since it does get kind of loud.

We can't say enough great things about Lux.  We stop in every morning after the gym for our daily fix, and the staff, coffee and food are great.  If you're feeling peckish in the evening, you'll enjoy dinner and really top-notch cocktails there as well.
There are plenty of coffee places in Phoenix, but no reason to go anywhere but Lux.
Love this place.  Great coffee, fabulous, homemade everything.  Can't beat it.

I have been a regular "Lux" drinker for years, and I stop by there at least 1-2 times a week if I can. I live up in Cave Creek, so believe me...the drive is worth it!

The Cave Creek Coffeee Company near my house has been going downhill fast for years (the coffee now sucks that Dave the owner is gone, and the attitude has gotten much worse. If I see another over- aged Harley biker wanna be... I'm gonna puke lol), and lets face it - when you get past all the artsy visuals, ambiance, wi-fi and the rest...in the end it is about the quality in the cup. 

In that department LUX truly kicks ass as the best coffeee in this town on many levels.

LUX is serious coffee - from the freshly roasted beans on premisis to the perfectly foamed lattes with artisan leaves created within the foam (try to get that anywhere else in town, including at the overrated Presse)...the barristas here know their Joe and take no prisoners. 

The mocha's have just the right balance of bitter chocolate and sweeteness, without being cloying or over bearing and the result is a nice balance of flavors that flow past your tongue. 

I generally drink my espresso straight, and at LUX it is obvious that the perfectly toasted nutmeg colored crema that the barristas pull is long lasting and as good as anything you'll find in Italy or Seattle, As soon as you walk in the door you can inhale the fresh roased beans and the wonderful smells wafting throughout. 

The goodies and cakes here have generally been pretty yummy, but I come here for my Espresso fix and so do other serious espresso afficionados.

I noticed a few Yelpers deriding the "crowd" here as pretentious, but I have to totally disagree.Honestly I find the vibe refreshing compared to Cave Creek or Scottsdale pseudo\/Harley Davidson chic with coffee that tastes mediocre. Yes, many of the college crowd here have full arm tats or are pierced, and you might even mistake this for an Apple Computer laptop camp. But I have always found the LUX bar staff to be EXTREMELY friendly and helpful, especially a gal named Shadie (probably mis-spelled - from Sounth Africa). The people here are just hanging out, lying on the comfortable furniture, or even falling asleep after a good cup o Joe (figure that out!).

The music and regularly changed artwork is nearly always cool and hip.

There is a reason that the New York Times ranked LUX the #1 coffee spot in all of Phoenix last year - the Espresso here is the real sh@t.

My favorite coffee shop in Phoenix. Step into this joint and you feel like you have been transported to a more cultured and diverse place. Its the first time I saw an Asian Barista in Phoenix. 

I usually come here to study and truthfully it gets a little loud at times so bring earplugs or anything else to plug your ears with. And on weekends you may have trouble finding a seat cause the place is packed. This place needs more outlets and the wifi can be sketchy at times. That said though I have a lot of love for independent coffee shops this one included.

They make pretty good white hot chocolates here. If you get a chance try one of their italian creme sodas ( i like peach). However, good drinks is only half the battle for a coffee shop, the joint also needs good bakery goods. Now the great thing about Lux is that I am pretty sure they bake most if not all their goodies on the premises. Hence, sometimes when walking towards the bathroom area your nostrils are greeted with whiffs of deliciousness. (theres a joke in there somewhere) Their Mexican Tea Cookies are always a good bet, and are reasonably priced. What I also like about this place is that they have rewards cards which I made ample use of. The Baristas in general are pretty cool laid back folk. 

So if your looking for an awesome coffee shop experience look no further then lux and if you don't have a car don't worry. Theres a lightrail stop right in front of it.

Really cool hipster coffee bar! They have an amazing breakfast menu and the food was delicious! For the price and quality of food, I was so shocked at the amount of people in here on a sunday late morning! This place is packed and people really love this place! I come here quite often for some cold brew! This place has amazing pastries, hot breakfast and coffee! Definitely come by and give this modern cafe a try!

So now that I'm working from home amidst traveling, I have basically turned lux into my makeshift office. I just have to say for the record, that i think their espresso gets better every single time I'm there.  Or maybe I just fall in love with it a little more each day! Seriously, shit is good.

I used to not be able to focus in here with all the 'scene-y' stuff (alluded to in other reviews) but now i've found that if i have work to do the noise and the people kind of make me motivated. It can get really dull working at your desk in your house.

I like that people hate so much on the mac-using, trendy people in the shop. Seriously? Who gives a shit? Unless they are mean to you or talk loudly about the previous nights parliament-smoking, pbr-drinking escapades - do you really care what kind of computer system they use and how skinny their jeans are? If so, I think it's time for a little introspection. But maybe i just take personal question to those reviews since i own a mac and am always working there :)

But either way - their pastries are divine, their espresso is excellent, and i have never in ALL of my visits to lux had a rude, pretentious, too-good, whatever barista. ever. they are really kind to everyone that ive ever watched order a drink.

i do get quite pissy however - when people sit down at shared tables and continue to cross, shift, and move themselves inevitably hitting the shared table about 8,000 times and spilling my coffee about 8,000 times. Come on folks, shared table...can i get a little consideration for your fellow coffee drinkers!?

the end.

Hey have really good coffee and whenever I'm not being too lazy, I make it here for breakfast- so good! I've never had anything I didn't like. The vibe is a little hipster but it's unique and has its own personality. I also really like the different stickers that they draw and change pretty regularly! I have a cool drawn yoda sticker from one time that was stuck on my pastry bag!

Dear Lord, this place is awesome. In fact, the only reason I didn't give it the full five stars is because, Dear Lord, is every seat in the place uncomfortable. Although, now that I think about it, you have to be EXTREMELY awesome to have this place packed on a daily and nightly basis when you know everyone's gluteus is miserable. Coffee A+, Food A++, The ability to make me feel like I'm not cool enough to be here A+++. But hey, I'll live... and go back frequently I might add.

Cute place with a nice vibe but littered with want-to-be homeless pretenticons.  Lots of seats open but this troll is using it for his laptop bag or ratty jacket. Kind of like a small version of the Seattle airport terminal. Hey, he's paid his $1.75 for an Italian soda, he got a right to loaf across the sofa for a couple if hours to read Kafka. I'll give them credit for not going to Starbucks but they probably tried and the furniture was too hard.  If it were in a real city it would be regular, because it's near this lifeless cluster of buildings called "downtown" it appears to be avant-garde.  

Great music and great coffee.  Clientelle, not so much. Will try again to compare notes.

I believe this is the best coffee in Phoenix. It has a cool vibe and I liked the coffee a lot. It was hard to find but once we did, we knew we were there. Other reviews are accurate that this place is hipster. It reminds me of Dunn Bros in St. Paul, MN. If I lived in Phoenix, I'd probably want to hang out here. I found the staff incredibly rude and had two of them tell me to get out of the way. It could have been a bad day for them but it soured my experience. The folks hanging out looked cool and I loved my latte. My bf enjoyed his regular coffee too. I asked what kind they have and they said, "light" and "dark" roasts. I was looking for a country or some other identifier but never feel like fussing too much. I'm not sure if I'd give it another chance on my next swing through town.
Kitchen closes earlier than they say it does and the last time I went I found 3 hairs in my coffee.

Very eclectic place to get an artisan cup of coffee in downtown Phoenix. Once you walk in, you see a barrage of students with laptops and cups of coffee. The place is usually packed when I go, so I opt for the patio on most visits. I normally get a black coffee and add the half and half myself. The menu has a lot of options--from espresso served 4 ways to an Arnold Palmer--so options are endless. Customer service is attentive and fast for Phoenix. 

I'm also a sucker for packaging and branding and I love the cute design of their menus. Will be trying their breakfast next time.
Lux is one of my favorite places for specialty drinks. If you are ready to try something new and edgy, order a drink when Sammy is working. You will not be disappointed.

Nice coffee shop for those located in the area. Super  assortment of baked goods. Yummy breakfast food. Very bohemian-ish. Reminded me of the coffee shop in Friends. :) 
Good place to meet up for social or business.
Very hipster-centric place. Never had a bad experience.
We started using luxe coffee at the office and can't get enough. The best! We need bulk discounts!

Worth the wait in line! All fresh, organic ingredients and food prepared with pride and love. The Baker gave us two free morning buns when she learned we were visiting from out of town. What a way to feel welcomed! Really enjoyed the laid back ambiance. Decided to wait for the bartender to arrive and enjoy their fresh fruit-inspired cocktail.

If you are looking for a unique café with a touch of a trendy look along with incredible cappuccinos and deserts then you have found your place! It does get pretty busy after 5, so get ready to wait in line.

Okay, so I admit it. Sometimes I get a stubborn idea about not wanting to go to a specific establishment due to a fierce loyalty to one of it's competitors. It took me a while to cave on this one. Too long in fact.

Everyone loves Lux and as it happens, they have good reason to! My latte was supremely delicious. The environment is great albeit slightly confusing as far as the flow of service. 

I absolutely love the patio area. This place definitely has a Pacific Northwest vibe that immediately resonates with me. The service was really laid back, yet authentically friendly. I was far too busy enthusiastically catching up with a dear friend to take in all that Lux has to offer. There's room in my heart for Lux after all so I shall return. My primary concerns going in were the coffee, service and atmosphere. A+ for all in my humble estimation. 

I was a little late to the party, but I had a blast anyway.

Seriously the best coffee and pastries! Its just so busy all the time now.. finding parking can be tricky, as well as a comfy place to sit.  But if you can get in, I definitely recommend their breve lattes and something off the menu!  Delicious!

This place is really laid back. Food selection changes on a daily basis. The crowd\/environment is definitely hipster-esque. Went in on a sunday  and there was a dj playing chillwave. The food is alright, the price is not too bad, but what really makes me come back is the ambiance at Lux. Sunday breakfast lines are super long.
I love this place and all of it's creativity. They have tons of awesome things, great coffee and food! I come here frequently for lunch as I work right down the street :)

First time here. It's got a cool vibe to it and the setup is interesting. Bustling place, came to meet friends from work and try their Mac and cheese. It was okay, nothing amazing but good nonetheless. Got a chocolate croissant but it tasted meaty so I returned it. They were nice enough to give me a refund.
Pastries and coffee are great.......everything freshly made and delicious.  The only drawback is that parking is a real b@#%* so many times I just don't go because it's too crowded.

this has to do a lot with one's opinion, however the place is nice.  laid back atmosphere, also having a Macbook Pro almost seems like a requirement to sip on some mocha at this place :)  my only complaint is that waiting in line and waiting for my coffee was just plain ackward.  the way the set up is...I'm sure it sounded good in therory

One of my favorite places in central Phoenix. Here is a review I wrote a while back: http:\/\/www.fatesjoke.com\/main\/index.php\/en\/writing\/reviews\/venues\/131-lux-central

I've been to Lux for Christmas, New Years and multiple other special occasions and have never regretted the choice. The staff makes you feel welcome and the food is not to be missed. Ask for a craft cocktail and you will get something that you've probably never heard of before, but it'll quickly become something you are ordering at the next place you have a drink.

I try to take everyone that comes from out of town to visit here, and I have yet to hear someone say it was a bad choice.

Love, love, love this place. So why am I not giving it 5 stars? Just a few picky things. The coffee line can be so long (worth it), but also their creative cocktails can break the bank. I went in on a Tuesday early afternoon doing some work from home and had two drinks. I didn't realize they were each $10. That with some mac and cheese made for a more expensive lunch than I expected. Other than that, they are awesome.

A little disappointed. I have been a Tarbell's diner since he opened .  A friend gave me a gift card, we had a nice dinner, and with the leftover decided to go next door, a few weeks later.
Why can you not use a Tarbell's gift card at both restaurants?  It's Tarbell's?  Maybe our server was misinformed?
Fox gift cards can be used at any of his venues.
I had an iced americano and a cookie with jelly on it that was amazing! I liked the crowd and thought the inside looked awesome! I would definitely go back!

Lux is a great place to meet with friends, do some homework, all while enjoying a creative beverage or item from their bakery. I love the environment, the music, and the food they offer. Definitely try their velvet (beverage), black & white (beverage), mac & cheese with bacon (amazing), oatmeal creme pies! Anything you choose will be awesome!
Great place! Hang out there all the time! Great coffee and food. I really can't sell it in words, you just have to try it!

This is such a cute and hipster coffee spot in Phoenix! I love that it's open very late and also offers food and drinks (alcohol included). 

I think the only thing that is a little harder is that it is somewhat difficult to find because the entrance is on the back side, not facing the street, and it looks like you're going nowhere because the street side looks closed, and also looks like you're going into the restaurant next door.

Once inside though, it's cute, but a little dungeon-ish. Not too much natural light in this concrete cave of a building. Their americano is pretty bomb, I haven't had any of the lattes but people seem to like their tea based drinks here. 

They also sell roasted beans, and the staff is very knowledgable of all of their products. Recommended!

Stopped here for our first morning in Phoenix cup of coffee, ordered a slice of walnut bread to go. This may be a hipster spot but could use a few soft spots to sit where the ugly grey stuffings not popping out,,,these seats look like germ city; tables look like they could use a good scrubbing; in the bakery area, toddlers walking around with bare feet and mommy is weaving thru the baked goods with her hair flying freely over to-be-baked-scones.
Walnut bread was just right and they don't skimp on the walnuts.

I so badly wanted to like this place because of all the wonderful reviews and pictures.
My experience: 
It was very easy to find and I got lucky and got a nice parking spot in the front as someone was leaving.
When I entered, it was a bit intimidating. There were people on their laptops and others just conversing and relaxing. When I finally figured out where the line was, I ordered a quiche lorraine, which was way too costy. For one small slide, it is $5! I can get an entire quiche for that price elsewhere. I wasn't sure which coffee to go with, but the cashier at the front was helpful. I got the cafe mocha. I specifically asked for it to be extra hot because that's the way I like my coffee and asked  to warm up my quiche as well. 
In less than a minute,  my mocha was ready, so I doubted that it was extra hot as I requested. Not to my surprise,  by the time they brought out my supposedly warm quiche, my mocha was pretty much cold! The quiche was also served cold, so I'm not sure why it took them so long to serve it to me (they were supposed to warm it up). Quiche Lorraines are usually served hot--not at lux apparently.  This saddened me because I was really craving one. I ate it, slowly.  It was not delicious but it was good. The mocha would have been better had it been hot.
Other than that, the vibe and atmosphere was not bad. Just a lot of college kids. I don't mind but....
Anyway, I like the typewriters as centerpieces,--pretty cool. I was hoping to make this place my "to-go cafe joint" but I'm not sure it's my type. A bit too crowded for me particularly.  I like more laid back type of cafes....
That's just me though.
:( spicy bacon and burnt hash browns make for a sad breakfast.
my 3rd place, hands down. find me here at least three times a week & I actually live 30 minutes away... but it's totally worth it. love the vibe, love the coffee, & especially love the mac n cheese
Enjoyed the few times Ive been here. The food is always good and so is the service.  The prices are a little too high fir what you get but there is a fun atmosphere that draws me back.

Great coffee in a comfortable environment. I love the couches and the DJ that was there that day. I have to say this is one of the few places that I have been with a great espresso shot. Many other places I have been burn the crap out of it. The espresso here was amazing!!! I will be back.

Why I (initially) gave Lux 2 stars:

-Definitely not the most intuitively arranged coffee shop I've ever been to. The space offered for your 5 minute wait for your cup of coffee is cramped.
-I've only been there four times, but three of those four were unpleasant experiences. They either messed up my drink, forgot to give me my food, or served me improperly prepared (very bitter) coffee. The last time I visited (my 4th time, in total) I ordered a decaf americano, and I was pleasantly surprised. After last time, I'm going to give them another chance.
-Parking. Is. A. Nightmare.

On the plus side, they have really good dinner foods (mac n cheese) and an (overpriced) wine bar, if you're into that scene\/old enough to enjoy that.

Why I updated my review to include a third star:

I visited an old friend for coffee, and she insisted we go to Lux, because she really likes it there. So, we went, and I got a simple cup of their light roast coffee (only $2. Not horribly expensive.) and was, once again, pleasantly surprised. It was smooth enough to drink without cream, milk or sugar. 
It was a Friday at lunch time, and it wasn't so busy. There was room to sit down, room to talk, room to wait for my cup of coffee without worrying about stepping on others' toes.
It was my first actual \/nice\/ experience at Lux, and I'm happy about it.
Very cool place. The service was excellent and everyone was so friendly. Haven't tried the coffee but the wine is amazing! Definitely will be back.

Lux is great. Set up with all the features than many-an-establishment might use to send off a douchey hipster vibe, Lux is as inviting as any other coffee shop I've visited. The staff is always friendly, the coffee is excellent, and, as an avid people watcher, it has a great atmosphere.

Seating can get restrictive but, generally, they've utilized their space well so I can't fault them for their popularity. The only knock would be that the music is sometimes turned up a bit loud -- but if that's the worst it has going for it, then I guess it truly is...."as good as it gets [five stars]
I've been here many times in the past... No room to disappoint. Everything about them is top notch and on point.

If you're out of town visiting and wondering if phoenix has good coffee, they do exist, and this is one is them. 

A bit on the pricey side, but nothing obscene. Tons of seating, even a quiet room to study and another room with a large TV. 

It definitely caters to the indie hipster scene, staff and customers all look the part. But did think it was a bit much when their menu says things like, "mason jar of fresh squeezed OJ," as if I would drink my beverage from any other beverage vessel. 

Plenty of parking, which felt luxurious.

This place is fantastic! Had their delicious fresh roasted coffee at a local restaurant and had to hit the cafe itself.

Just looking at their amazing baked goods display would prompt a celiac sufferer to hit the depression meds. I mean their stuff looks Fantastic. It's hard not to get more than one thing! Best flaky biscuits ever, great croissants and scones too. Their breakfast hash is also quite good (especially the crispy bits) and thankfully it's veg- friendly but won't disappoint the meat eaters.

The staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is comfortable for a long drawn out cup of coffee or meal. The decor is an eclectic mix of designy and vintage objects (you can show your kids what a real typewriter looks like), though it's a tad forced.

Come for the coffee, stay for the baked goods! You won't be disappointed.

Really cool and hip place for a great coffee and snack. I ordered an Iced americano with a sugar donut and was pretty happy with both! Although the coffee was good, the donut was more memorable. It was a sugar and cinnamon donut, but what set it apart was it's use of salt in the dusting mixture. I loved the contrast that the salt brought to the sweetness of the sugar and cinnamon.

I've been here a few times at varying hours but probably wouldn't recommend it as the type of coffee shops you go to study at, because it's always packed and loud. 

Other than it always being too crowded I really like this place and would go back, especially for their pastries!
Always friendly service that goes beyond expectations. Coffee isn't perfect (please add a cold brew) but I am never disappointed.
Really good food and fun place, but it's always annoyingly crowded and it's really tough to find a place to sit, but the food is great and the people try to be helpful.

This place was great, we actually went to lunch next door, and noticed several people sitting outside enjoying various beverages.

I loved the place, the moment i walked in. A busy urban coffee shop, lots of people chatting, working, studying,  a display of pastries. They even serve lunch\/dinner, a bar. 

 I got the white chocolate latte,  my husband got the caramel latte, and a chocolate chip cookie, and an almond raspberry pastry i believe. The lattes had beautifull art on them, were serverd at a perfect temperature,  were smooth and delicious. The pastries were also great. 

I wish they had another location  in scottsdale, however i will return to their current location.

My boyfriend brought me here and let me tell you, I've wanted to finback ever since. 

We went late on a Saturday night and it was JAMMED, but it's so big that there was still plenty of room to find a table to kick back and have some great conversation. 

Their menu is surprisingly homey. I ordered garlic mashed potatoes and broccoli, but they had run out of broccoli. I saw a bowl of avocados and asked if I could just sub them instead. It ended up being one of the most mouthwatering dinners ever. They did something magical to the avocado like grilled it and put some spices on it or something and their mashed potatoes were something out of heaven. Next time definitely trying whatever concoctions they have at the bar.

Favorite coffee house in the country. Environment is the best I've ever experienced, and the drinks are great. Music is phenomenal and they regularly rotate local art throughout the shop. Great hours and lots of art\/design mags around to browse through.

This is now my favorite place to get coffee in the Phoenix area. The brew tastes great and is fairly priced. A large latte is 4 bucks. The best part about this place is the atmosphere. There are a lot of 20 somethings that regular here with their iBooks and headphones, but there are still just as many people socializing. It is crowded, but with lots of good seating. There is an area with great comfy chairs and leather couches. There are also ample tables to keep your laptop on. The walls are littered with interesting local, contemporary art. 

Half the time I'm here I take my headphones off because I enjoy the music they play so much. They even have a pitcher of free lemon ice water. :)
Words of caution: it can be pretty packed sometimes and parking is tricky! Other than that, this is a great little cafe with nice coffee, pastries, and other drinks\/food.

(And update to a brutal review I made about them before- they're better now)
First, Lux desserts are painfully perfect.  I've had the carrot cake, choc chip blondie, m and m cookie, etc etc. apple something, salted caramel something else...and each time I make the remark.. "I could literally crush every last one of those f-ing desserts and never look back".  Scary good.. Soft... Insane. 
Second, the sugar free caramel latte iced or hot with the dope leaf design in the foam- thumbs up.  Sizes are one stage smaller than most places but I'll take it if it lets them stay open and profitable.  
Oh ya open late!!!!! Till midnight thru the week and 2 on the weekends.  Finally!  Xtreme bean is the only other contender. 

*Evolve 
*Be happy 
*Don't tell people what to do or how to feel at the end of your posts
Always different pastries and they are tasty. Friendly baristas. Only been in the morning so don't know how the night crowd is. Is always busy and can be challenging to find a seat sometimes.

Chester came in around 7PM and the place was hopping. The experience started well when Chester was greeted by a svelte strawberry blonde. She sold him on a vegan cookie. It was made of oatmeal and surely some secret ingredient (CRACK) that made it taste so good. The adorable brunette with bangs got the drink out FAST which was good because there were a lot of impatient coffee "connoisseurs" waiting in line behind Chester. 

Chester thinks the adorable baristas made a poopy day much better. The girl up front gave him such a nice complement and didn't rush Chester like they do at Sh*tbucks. It's amazing what a smile and good cup of coffee can do for Chesters' mental health. Thank you, Lux lady. 

Iced coffee, service, people watching, and vegan cookies are very good in Chester's humble opinion.
absolutely perfect evening with excellent staff. They really love there job and thats why i only shop here.

Lux regular. Yeah it can seem vey hipster or pretentious but if you're brave enough to tread the super hip hipsters and break a little awkward sweat for $2 endless refills for the dark or light roast then you have made it my friend.
If your in town must stop by and try their red velvet latte! Their interior is slightly strange to me.. However they do have great coffees and pastries!

My string of visiting exceptional coffee houses over the last week continues, this time in Phoenix.  Lux bills itself as a micro-roaster.  It is that, as well as a great place to work, network, meet friends old and new.  A great find in Phoenix!  If I continue to travel for work, Lux will be a must-visit stop when in Phoenix!  I recommend the House Special Black & White Latte.

Very impressive space and design.  I attended the "soft" opening and was very pleased. If you like artistically crafted drinks... this is the place for you.
I enjoyed a "Black" Manhattan which was made with Rye Whiskey. It was perfect! Of the menu items I was able to sample the macaroni and cheese was very impressive. Completely unique and light, where most mac and cheeses are clumpy, heavy and boring.

The staff is delightful!

I can't wait to come back to Phoenix and get my LUX on!!
My fave coffee spot in Phoenix. The vibe is very chill. The service is great. And the coffee..... Very good. A++!! I highly recommend!

I'm in town for work from Atlanta, and my first thought walking into LUX was "why don't we have one of these on ATL?!"

It is a bit hidden, there is no large indicating where it is, I just happened to follow the right person walking into the coffee shop.

As soon as I walk in, I noticed the large display of baked goods. I wanted the mixed berry muffin SOOOOO bad, but I am trying to stay away from sugar right now so I passed :(
I ordered an Americano and it was quite delicious. Wish I could've stayed to lounge around a big on the big comfy yellow couch, but I had to leave for work. 

High recommend! I want to go back for more hipster yummy goodness!

Love this place. Awesome spot to get great drinks (booze and caffeine) as well as some grub. Open till 2am and cool decor. Def one of the "hipsterish" spots in town but not as bad as Cartel in Tempe and great place to work--just be prepared for crowds.
Love this place!!! Their ice vanilla latte is the best I've had, so delish. Only bad thing is that it is always super busy so it's not always easy to find a seat.

Lux has mastered the amazing way of combining happening, yet slow paced; friendly yet quietly independent; trendy, yet relaxed. Go to Lux for the amazing coffee and wifi, but come away with an appreciation for great spaces, new friends, and a quiet buzz that'll make you want to come back again and again.

The "new" Lux is a great space: once you think you've found a quiet place to crawl into and observe the crowd, you'll discover that the building just continues and continues! There's a spot to people watch, enjoy the football game that's on, or power through your emails at a large table. If you're not in the mood to stay inside, hit up the small patio and listen to the chatter around you. 

If coffee isn't your thing, order wine or beer! I haven't tried their food but just from the looks of the dishes that friends have ordered, I don't think you can go wrong. The only thing that keeps Lux from getting five stars? It's crazy overpriced! Their cheapest glass of wine is $9. 

All in all, go to Lux just for the experience. I promise you won't regret it.

What great coffee? Come here. 
What a nice atmosphere to study or chat with friends? Come here. 
I really enjoyed this space & will definitely be returning.
This is my favorite place locally here in Phoenix, absolutely great coffee! Next to central highschool and light rail so there can be traffic when school let's out or rush hour.

My new favorite stop in Phoenix!  I love this place -- the iced mochas are spectacular... and so far, the pastries have all been amazing!  So nice to find a place like this here in Phoenix... it reminds of the Bucktown\/Wicker Park neighborhoods in Chicago... my old stomping grounds!  Yay!!

Cute spot for breakfast and lunch. We came for breakfast early when it opened at 6a. Unfortunately we came earlier than when their full kitchen opens at 7a, so we weren't able to order a made-to-order dish, however there were some bakery items fresh out the oven available. We both got fresh squeezed grapefruit juice. I got a quiche lorraine and my sister got a danish. The prices are high for the portion. The atmosphere seems to cater to both older and younger clientele. Great for chilling over coffee with friends or putting on some headphones and getting to work.

Grabbed a quick breakfast here before our flight back to Seattle. After asking about options without egg, they told me I could order the oatmeal. While I wasn't particularly enthralled with the idea of oatmeal that morning, I went with it since breakfast with an egg allergy is often a difficult - so one option is better than none.

Holy hell, was I glad I opted for the oatmeal!! This might have been one of the best oatmeals I've had served to me yet! Served in a giant coffee mug, it was covered with a generous pile of warm toasted pecans and juicy raspberries, with a mingling of raspberry juice and (I think) maple syrup to sweeten the oats underneath. It was filling, it was simple, it was delicious, it was heavenly. 

As I board my flight back to my home hundreds of miles away, I don't know whether I love or hate them for setting the oatmeal bar so high when I can't go back every time I'm craving this decadent bowl of oatmeal. :)

Coffee was also good!

Great selection of drinks and food but WAY overpriced. It's surprising to me that this place stays super busy with prices like this. I've been a customer since they were a small place in the adjacent building and the menu has definitely been expanded with the building size. All good things (minus the prices). Ambiance is eclectic and trendy. Can be a little noisy for studying but good for conversations. Overall, I would recommend this place just wished the prices were better.

Lux's luster still shines on, it's my go-to cafe to frequent, it's almost a problem how often I visit. I still ultimately love most things about this cafe and have probably been here more times then I can remember.

The reason behind the dropped star is that I've noticed that the workers can be a bit short and the food a bit too salty. Heavy seasoning hands on the chefs here. I ordered the Yorkshire Pudding Burger with Beet chips and though the Yorkshire pudding, aioli and beet chips were tasty the burger patty itself was too salty. The Yorkshire pudding seemed a bit too tough, kind of expected a more flaky texture and the patty cooked a bit over to my "Medium Rare" preference though stated during my order.

Alas, if there's one thing you should order here besides the pastries and other dishes on their changing menu it's their Mac & Cheese. It's not the nostalgic bright, orange Mac N Cheese that comes in a blue and yellow box ... but it is definitely next level. Perfectly cooked macaroni, creamy and gooey, melty cheese sauce. I also got mine with bacon and jalapeños, which gave it a bit of heat and a smokey, saltiness from the bacon.

Other than that, the drinks, pastries, well dressed folk, sociable people, table space, fast wi-fi and late hours of operation are still a win in my book.

I really like this coffee bar, if you are driving north on central if you aren't careful you will most likely drive right by this place.  You have to make a U turn about a quarter mile from the actual entrance to the place.  Their hibiscus tea is my drink of choice and I do rather enjoy their pastries.  I go here quite often to study, but it definitely can be a little bit noisy in here.  There is free wifi and free refills on tea drinks.  I've had their mushroom soup and it was quite delicious.  From what I've been told, their lunch menu items are pretty good.  They also don't mind if you bring outside food when you come.

It is already so crowded in the morning that another Five Star Review might only bring more Yelpers into the fold, but that is what this is - a FIVE STAR REVIEW.

From unique seating to incredible baked goods (have tried a dozen different ones and each is WONDERFUL!), to great coffee (I prefer "Dark" at $2 and FREE refill) and NOT TO BE MISSED hot breakfast entrees (BEST Gravy and Biscuits I have had in Phoenix - I prefer Sausage - Dutch Pancake, where I prefer the sweet).

There have been occasions (rare!) where I have not had to wait, but most times there is a line. Worth whatever wait is in store.

Great place for Breakfast or just coffee and a newspaper!

Definitely not my scene! Very urban feel. I got a weird vibe. Perhaps too many judge-y twenty-somethings at one time. 

Their tea is good and inexpensive! 

I couldn't wait to get out of the building though... too much going on at one time. It was overwhelming.

i can see why this place is popular. it's definitely hip and in a cool location. their coffee and their service have only been mediocre in my experiences, however. bitter shots and huge bubbles in the milk. even though the place is well known, you can probably find better quality and less of a pretentious atmosphere elsewhere.

Food here never disappoints. The baked goods here are so good, and despite how busy it is, the employees are always very cordial. We try to avoid coming here on weekends as it's packed, though we do get lucky with seating and parking.

One criticism I have of the place is that the layout is pretty chaotic. Sometimes you're literally stepping over other people's babies in their baby carrier trying to avoid them, or bumping into people holding plates and hot drinks. That, and despite being crowded, people just linger and sit around for long periods of time. 

But for the most part, I love the food, drinks and ambiance. And I love that it's a more youthful crowd. So despite a few things that are a bit annoying, we keep coming back.

First up, great coffee. It's a shame they have such tasty mochas, because here is a place you can get a solid cap or espresso without fear. Just too many decisions. Their homemade whipped cream is amazing, so I often open for the quad-shot con pana to light me up. It's fantastic.

Next up, friendly, smart staff. They always seem extra happy, which may be the constant buzz from the espresso and whipped cream rushes I am sure they cruise on all day.

Cap it off with tasty pastries, nice vibe and decor, and it is one of my favorite coffee shops in town.

The only downside at all is that it's popularity can make it crazy busy, so if you're looking to sit and relax or work for a bit, get there eeeeeeearly.

After dinner with friends last night we decided to go for some coffee ans desert. Conveniently located on Central between IndianSchool and Camelback, right in front of the light rail. (don't miss it, its a hidden gem)  My friend suggested Lux and I was pleasantly surprised walking into what seemed to be some sort of old warehouse that had been turned into a fun laid back coffee shop\/restaurant. There were so many people relaxing enjoying coffee with friends, people on their laptops studying and working and a bar full of laughter enjoying cocktails and food. I had a vanilla latte accompanied by a tasty lemon bar which is made fresh in the kitchen everyday and the menu is always changing. Lux roasts their coffee in house so the aroma when you walk in is absolutely amazing. This seems to be a great place to go if you are new in town and want to meet new people. The atmosphere is very young and friendly, lots of college students. 
I will definitely be returning! 

P.S. beware... I am told the macaroni and cheese is to die for!

You really gotta be either insane or an idiot to mess with near perfection, and that's exactly what Lux did when they moved next door and added liquor to the mix.

Well that is unless I guess you really know what you're doing ... and the owners CLEARLY know what they are doing. This place is bigger and better than the old Lux and I never expected to say that.

This place is a diamond in the rough. There is no coffee shop within 300 miles that is this hip, this cool and this awesome.

Oh yeah ... the coffee is damned good to!

Easily one of my favorite coffee shops in the Phoenix area. Relaxing vibe with a twist of a busy vibe. Could easily study or go out for a drink here. Best desserts and great coffee. The only thing I'm not crazy about is how to order, where to order. I think they could be a little more clear. Looking forward to trying meals here!
One of the best places in Phoenix to do...anything.  Date night?  Studying?  Catching up with old friends?

What a fantastic gem in Phoenix! Yummy coffee, awesome "soundtrack", super delicious food and scones, and the atmosphere is inviting and fun. I'm visiting here from San Diego, so I'm used to good coffee and have become somewhat of a coffee snob, this does not disappoint.

Been here a number of times for coffee, but never had the dinner options or beer.  Great assortment of independent brews.  The food was unexpected amazing. Try the jalapeño Mac n cheese.  The place has never let me down.

Lux is one of those coffee shops in Phoenix that as a coffee lover, you must try once, because whether you like it or not, this is a beehive for people and ideas. Aside from boasting solid roasts, a large baked goods selection, and a full bar, its central location and late hours makes this 'the spot' for hipsters, millennials, freelancers, and students alike. If you like to people watch and engage in random conversation amidst laptop work, or come hang out with your friends, this is the place. I've been approached to be a hair model (not creepy, awesome), gotten recommendations on books, found and returned a wallet, and gotten my laptop work done, all while sitting down by pink Starship Trooper paintings on the wall. Bring your headphones if you want to tune the chaos out, but if you'd rather do that, you should probably go to another coffee shop instead.
Service is great. Servers are friendly. Cool, eclectic vibe. Iced Americano was as good as any I've had. My new favorite coffee spot in PHX.

Nothing beats good coffee, homemade pastries and breakfast dishes.  Everything tastes fresh and delightful. The best yogurt parfait I had ever eaten, smooth, soft with balanced crunchiness from the granola.  Not too sweet, just right!  Wish I could have this everyday.  Will definitely come back to Phoenix for this place!
Just admit to being a hipster already and you'll fit right in! Best red velvet cake ever!

This spot is definitely hipster. I was recommended by a friend that used this place to study at. The place is pretty small and kind of anxiety-inducing because it was so packed and loud (definitely a younger crowd). There was no seating indoors so I sat outside at the picnic tables, near the parking lot. 
The coffee was alright and the ordering process was confusing and lacked proper direction. There also wasn't really a waiting area for your coffee so I felt in-the-way most of the time.

I've been frequenting this place for a loooooong time. It reminds me of the funky artsy coffeehouses in LA, around the Melrose District. Their hodgepodge of furniture - Midcentury rejects line the walls and old backlight tables - complement the easy, laidback vibe of the place. Of course, the Mac crowd wouldn't have it any other way.

I haven't ever had a cup of coffee in my life but they always have juice, Vitaminwater and other non-coffee alternatives to choose from. Plus they have a few treats, like brownies, to snack on. This place is MRB approved!!!

I love the new location. I know, I know, everyone has been talking about it for years. I live in the 'hood, and didn't much like the old location. Walking into a cafe, only to see a sea of laptops, isn't very welcoming. Not their fault, of course.

The new location offers up some tasty treats. I've had a few of the breakfast and lunch items. 

It can be a bit confusing to find it at first. You have to go in the back door. (Hahahahaha you know what *I* am thinking, right?) Picking up your order is tricky, because it gets loud in there and you may not hear your name called.

I prefer the back (front) room. Less traffic, and there's a cool bar to sit at.

Lux has the best coffee in town, hands down. They roast the beans on site, never bitter like that overdone Starbucks stuff. My penchant for sugar-free vanilla latte's always satisfied here. Free wi-fi. The staff do some jedi mind trick and always remember my name. I can bring my dog, they remember her name too.

BOTTOM LINE: Sometimes I dream of this coffee

The coffee and pastries are to die for and there is no room to complain about that, unfortunately I could not say the same about their bar drinks. I have had about 4 drinks from the bar in my many visits and each time I regret it immediately.
True baristas. Artisans. I'm ruined for life. Can you come to Montana?:) pastries and the cappuccino were absolute perfection!!!

Incredible food, whether you just grab a fresh-made scone, or order a full meal. Good coffee. It can get crowded, but it is a fun and eclectic atmosphere. I definitely try to bring out-of-town visitors to Lux to get a good feel for urban Phoenix culture.

Should you be sensitive to loud noises, fear crowded spaces, or cringe at a sea of be-speckled people sitting in front of macs, Lux may not be the place for you. However, if you enjoy a busy slice of downtown Phoenix, delicious espresso, tattoo watching, eating pastries outside, and freshly prepared breakfast, I would suggest you try this place out. The traffic flow of this place drives me insane, but then I have some coffee, maybe a cookie, and calm down to watch the word move by likely to a DJ-spun beat.

Lux is almost too cool for me, as if it were a club only for the initiated. But once past that, this place is everything a coffee joint and cocktail lounge should be: completely unique, and serious about their business.

I told the bartender I was looking for an interesting cocktail, he asked me what I usually like to drink, and then he told me to take a seat--he would bring me something I would like. That's confidence, from a guy who knows his craft.

My cocktail and coffee were excellent, and though I didn't fit in to the crowd very well, I did not feel rushed or unwelcome. One of my very favorite places.
A great place to grab a coffee, delicious breakfast, pastry or tea!  Fun to meet a friend or host a business catch up.  Lovely lovely establishment!

Really cute hip coffee hangout. Most of their pastries are gluten free. The place is always busy especially on the weekend but its a great place to meet over coffee.  They serve basic breakfast options and their service is fast and friendly.

I've been looking for a place that has latte art, my niece and her boyfriend goes to Lux quite often so my friends and I decided to give it a try one night. The place was super busy. Seating was hard to find because of how busy the place was. They do have an outside seating area  but it was too cold to be sitting outside. I asked one of the guys if I can move one of the chairs so that my friend and I could sit together, but he was no help. He told me he don't know and moved on. The latte was good and even better because there was cute art to go along with it. That made me happy. The muffin I ordered was a little dry but the peanut butter cake my friend had ordered  was okay. This place is a good place to hang out with friends on a late night and if anyone who wants to try latte and see some cute artwork, try this place out.

The cinnamon roll was delicious. The white mocha is my favorite. Their homemade whipped cream can be added to any drink and I recommend it. The food menu items change on a daily basis. Wonderful place in downtown. Many options to eat and drink. Friendly staff and great atmosphere. Great place to get work done or just hang out. Highly recommended!
KATIE CALLAHAN AND JEFF! Nuff said. They made Phoenix cool again with this spot.

Another little gem I will miss from Phoenix.  Words that describe this place: Cute, unique, retro, fresh, simply (menu's), and lively.  

I have been to this place twice on two different visits, both times really packed.  I like this ambiance.  The coffee menu was simple and the coffee was individually made.  If you are looking for a spot to study or relax and people watch..this is the spot.  Otherwise, bring headphones, you'll still enjoy it minus the noise. :) Enjoy!

Oh and btw..i ordered the Red Eye coffee with room for cream and hazelnut (their delicious coffee with two shots of espresso over ice!)

Love it!  The espresso is great and I love that I can get almond milk lattes!  Sometimes they have vegan gluten-free desserts, which is an added bonus.  This place is always crowded, but that is just part of the deal.  Highly recommended!
I've only been here a few times, but each time it gets better and better. Staff is friendly and welcoming. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a fun coffee shop & study spot.

What We Ordered: Espresso Quattro Con Panna, White Out Cappuccino, Chocolate Chip and Sea Salted Cookie

Service: Friendly staff, order up counter

What We Liked: 
-Atmosphere: trendy, industrial, eclectic, good environment for studying (which many people were doing - I would as well). Unusual open concept kitchen with basket of food along the counters which worked with the atmosphere.
-Espresso: smooth espresso! The Quattro con panna was delicious with the smallest hint of sweetness and nice smooth espresso. Made me want to try all of their coffee concoctions. 
-Options for coffee and wine: I like this combination and it was executed well in the building itself, being somewhat separate from each other
-Baked good: a good ol' choc chip cookie. Not much more to say about a cookie. :) 

What We Disliked:
-Not much. Just maybe the cleanliness. 

Overall, a hip "young" place packed with 20 and early 30-somethings. Most people were studying with their laptops at all the eclectic tables. It seems like a place to meet new people and the vibe was casual and friendly. The tables, seating and building itself is certainly rough around the edges but it works for this place. The chairs and tables are not very comfortable so I wouldn't come here to chit-chat for a couple hours with a friend at the tables but I would come here to study at them. Although I didn't sit at the bar, that did look inviting. I would come back to try the wine, more coffee, and their other delicious-looking baked goods.

To be honest, I was quite surprised to find an establishment like this in Phoenix! Mainly because I didn't know hipsters existed in Arizona! I walked in and thought "Wait...am I in Phoenix or Silverlake (LA)!!!" 

My friend who is visiting for a rotation told me he goes here to study for his boards. Love the decor, vibe, but most importantly, the food!

My friend had the yogurt and granola, I had a strawberry thumbprint cookie, and we each got vanilla lattes. Coffee here is smooth, not bitter, and they top it off with a design in the foam! Lovin' it! 

This place is HUGE even though it doesn't look that way from the outside. Plenty of places to sit with your Macbook or a novel and Free Wifi.  I went on a weekend so it was packed, like line-out-the-door packed, but I still didn't have to wait too long to find a place to sit and study. 

It's about a 25 minute drive from Glendale so I will definitely be back. Very reasonably priced (if you can afford Starbucks then you can afford this...plus you get WAYYYY better quality). Parking is easy as they have a lot and plenty of street parking. Oooh and I forgot to mention Pane Bianco is right next door with delicious sandwiches, soups, and desserts so you should check it out!
People wait in a very long line to get coffee here. The coffee IS good and worth the wait but what is better is the feel of the place. It's great.

Lux = quality on all levels. Java, juice, pastries, breakfast quiche is yummy,  art work, clientele, and especially the wonderful staff. I'm a regular here and have never had a negative experience. I'm very much looking forward to the new Lux opening just next door!

I don't know how, in the course of three years on Yelp, I have neglected to write about one of my most beloved Phoenix locales. Forgive me, Lux Coffeebar, but I think I got so distracted by COMPLAINING about OTHER places, that I have not had the chance to shower you with accolades. 

Lux Coffeebar is by far, the best coffee in downtown\/central Phoenix. They are consistent, offer a full espresso menu, and actually KNOW what a real macchiatto is. They offer a vast selection of in-house baked goods that are always incredibly satisfying and they are located right off the light rail next to one of the best lunch locations in the city (Pane Bianco). Their prices are low-normal and their interior is bright, clean, and full of local art. While their sleek, mod-inspired furniture may be intimidating to some (on first glance it  looks a little snotty), Lux is like a second home to me and has always been welcoming and comfortable. Its regular patrons are the type of people who will leave you alone if you're working on something on your laptop, but are always friendly for some conversation if you're feeling lonesome. It's good for meeting people and for studying, and the baristas are some of the best I have ever met in both skill and personality. They roast their beans in-house and also offer their coffee for home brewing. Owner Jeff Fischer (who is great with remembering names of regulars) is on the premises DAILY working both behind the bar and making fresh deliveries to his business of fresh fruit and ingredients for their wonderful tarts and other goodies. His wife Tara often brings over their little ones and over time you see that this hip location is really a down-to-earth family business in disguise. They even have a nice selection of glass-bottled sodas (real cane sugar only) and designer water. During the summer, their lemonade really hits the spot. Versatile, stylish, and full of that small-local business charm, Lux is one of the only places I will really, really, really miss when I relocate to California next month.

PS: Lux Coffeebar has a beautiful working relationship with Pane Bianco and you can bring your lunch inside without having someone nag you about outside food or drink, so eat up and grab a coffee while you're at it!

Love this place! Wish Phoenix  had more places like these. Lux is a chill place where I can enjoy a good cup of joe while I get lost in my book. Their quiche is scrumptious and pastries\/cookies are heavenly. I brought my sister and she loved Lux! 

Subtracted 1 star for the parking. Space is  limited in the back

Once again I was pleasantly surprised!
Love their rustic atmosphere, out waiter was blunt and to the point. Loved it!
Dessert was too rich for me but I was the one that chose the cheesecake, so that's on me. Would def be returning. My dads in town soon, he would love it!!!
Always a fan of getting coffee and working on homework here. Can get really business during peak times but lots of seating available.

The pastry section was good. 
The scone however was mediocre. 
The coffee bread and lavender bread was very good.
