Another thing about the line... I actually saw several small groups leave after waiting too long.

The people who started Lux saw potential, but I don't think they know how to run a coffee shop.  Unfortunately this is the only true game in town and people are going to put up with this until someone opens the competition.
I loved the vibe and the food was delicious. Thanks for representing phoenix so well!

Delicious gourmet food combined with a super friendly and casual atmosphere. I'm from out of town and was pleased to find this great local gem. Spacious with tons of seating, communal and private tables. I ate lunch, so I can't speak for those other tempting offerings, but the steak and cheese sandwich I had was fantastic and I would definitely come back to check out the cocktails at the bar across the room from the coffee counter.

Have been Lux several times now and each time our experience has been consistently the same....fantastic!!!  Their chai latte and coffee are great.  Their baked goods are tasty.  The service is friendly and energetic.  The only downside...lots of others apparently think the same SO it's crowded.  Expect to wait during peak times and it is crowded!

Love everything about this place, great coffee, huge area with plenty of room even when it is busy. The only complaint I have is that the music is a bit loud and distracting if you are trying to work or study, so much so that you can't listen to your own music on headphones to tune it out. Other than that, I love this place and will continue to go there regardless!!

A must try just for the atmosphere! My husband and I, I would say, have just aged-out of the target demographic of this place. We actually brought our baby (as I said, just aged-out, so new baby must come along on vacations) and it was super chill. While there was no sitting inside, the outside was a lovely Phoenix evening with a lovely crowd of folks. 

We tried out pastries and coffee drinks. The pastries--Red Velvet Cake and Lemon Bar--I wanted to love because they came on adorable mismatching china, but at that late hour they had unfortunately staled. 

But the coffee! I had a decaf Americano and it was maybe the best coffee I've ever had. And to be honest, decaf is never good. It's just something to sip on whole others have a cocktail. This decaf, though...

My husband waited in the epic cocktail line (separate from the food\/coffee drink line) and asked the bartender to surprise him with something coffee-based. He was served some kind of masterpiece of spirits and freshly-pulled espresso, complete with thoughtful aromatic garnishes. Again, rocking coffee.
Been awhile since I visited but wanted to give them some mega praise. Best Mac & Cheese I ever had. Loved watching World Cup games there too this summer. Wonderful place. I'll be back for sure.
have jake create you a drink at the bar. i promise you won't regret it.

Black n white latte and peanut butter cookies........I'm in heaven!!!!!!!!!

Walking into this place I was immediately impressed with the decor.  I love places that look cool without looking like they tried too hard.  I was actually concerned because places like this usually have baristas that think they're too good for you.  This place was different!  The cashier immediately sparked up a cute witty banter and suggested their house specialties.  We went with one vanilla latte (my standard) and a Black and White latte which mixes dark and white chocolate.  Both were really amazing.

Another cool aspect is their little in house bakery.  On your way down the hall to the restrooms, you can sneak a peak at where they smelt up their decadent baked goods.  It looks so fun! I wanted to ask her if she needed any help!   Well, at least I got to take part in eating the final product...Peanut Butter Cookies!!

This place was fantastic!  It is open late which is always nice.  They have a full bar for those who want to continue with the nights festivities but they also have OUTSTANDING coffee!  It is the kind of place where you can hang out for hours and go back for a few cups so come either with good friends or a good read.  I plan on going back to try the food but unfortunately, only went for late after dinner coffee this time around.  I love that you can see them cooking right there in front of you.  Can't wait to go back!
Such a trendy atmosphere and great coffee\/food! Got the honey vanilla latte and lemon bar.. absolutely delicious!

This is the epitome of hipster coffee shops and I love everything about it. There's 80's New Wave blasting in the background while the dishwashers in the back have Gin and juice on. There's a wide selection of pastries and a full kitchen where you can get real entrees. I can hear coffee beans drumming in the background so they must roast beans here although I can't smell it. There's so much going on, you'll love it. My husband finished his delicious egg sandwich before I could snap a picture. I ordered a quiche and it was delectable. If I'm ever back in town, I'll be sure to stop but again.

READ EVERY PAGE OF YOUR LEASE AGREEMENT THOROUGHLY. DON'T RELY ON ANYTHING YOU ARE TOLD OR YOU WILL LEARN THE HARD WAY THAT NOTHING AT VASEO IS AS GOOD AS THEY CLAIM AND THEY ONLY ACKNOWLEDGE WHAT IS IN WRITING!   I moved my family to Vaseo after taking the nice tour with a very friendly woman who told us about all kinds of amenities and activities that Vaseo had to offer. In our move,it was most important to us that we find a place with 24 hour pool and gym access because we work odd hours and we were also looking for a place that had a pool that was heated in the winter so we could exercise all year round as we had both of those things at our last apartment and they were on our had to have list. We were told that there were 4 pools at Vaseo and that one of the pools was heated year round so we were sold. Then, we tried to swim in the pool in October, it was bone numbing cold, my skin turned beat red, and my body movements slowed. I called to ask about the heat in the pool and they originally told me that they don't start to heat the heated pool until November. Went back in November and there was no change in temp and then I was told they only heat their pool to 70 degrees (actually about 60-65), which in no way can be considered a "heated pool" because a heated pool standard temp is 85 degrees None of the employees know where the temperature switch is and they have no thermometers in any of the pools. I don't think the heated pool even has a heater.They have several hot tubs at Vaseo but they only heat them to around 80 degrees when the standard hot tub temperature is usually 100-102 degrees, so there's usually a ton of unsupervised kids jumping in and out of the hot tubs because the hot tub is more like a warm bath. Oh ya, as it turns out, the pools all close at 10pm instead of being available 24 hours as we were told, and this is the only thing the security squad seems to enforce like Martial Law.Very disappointing since all the things we moved here for were promised and never delivered. One good thing about Vaseo is the Happy Hour that they host about 8 times a year and welcome everyone to come and eat and drink and meet their neighbors. Its usually free and its a pretty cool thing to do. It doesn't quite make up for all the problems they create and the poor management of the complex, but it is something.

I'm definitely NOT a hangout at a coffee shop kinda girl, but if I *was* this is the place I would set up shop to read, write, draw, browse a magazine, meet a date or just people watch.

I met bonnie here pre-Chez Nous HH (that turned into evening since I got off work late) because my coffee shop connoisseur friend was posting up there until I got off work down the street. I admit I am directionally challenged to degree that is not only embarrassing, but debilitating. If you feel for me, take heed - I drove past it not once but two times. Add to that the light rail construction (it is right on central) and my post-work brain just about exploded. Poor bonnie had to take three calls from me before going out to the street to wave me in like an airplane.

But, once safely in the parking lot, there were ample spaces and I was surprised to see that pane bianco was right next door! Then it all made sense - why that phoenix cool-baby marketing rep asked me a date here, why so many people that I would not imagine know about these kinds of things seem to love talking about lux. It's right next door to prob one of the busiest\/coolest places to pick up sandwiches for up-and-coming downtowners (uptowners?). 

Well, although bianco was long-closed, lux was happenin' at 7 at night. there was plenty of comfy seating (two couches, and easily 7 or 8 arm chairs) plus a long table seemingly designated for setting up laptops. The staff seemed friendly and nice, and I really liked that the shelves for placing flyers was inset into the counter where you order - still visible but not at all the messy eyesore they inevitably end up being.

Ok, now for my favorite part - the clipboards that hang on stings against the wall so that patrons can hang their own sketches, drawings, paintings - whatever. (miss bonnie herself added a RAD sketch of a sexy bunny-man, I suggest you check it out).

Sorry to say I did not taste the coffee or the treats, so I can't speak to that. But, I would most definitely go back to do so.

Lux is a great place to meet a friend for coffee. Super hip and fun vibes. It can get very busy on the weekends so I would recommend a weekday visit. Pastries and drinks are all delicious. I haven't tried their other food offerings but those look great as well. Baristas and staff are pretty friendly for the most part. This is definitely one of the best coffee shops in Central Phoenix.

Lux is scene. I was amazed to see how packed the coffee shop was at 1030AM, aren't people supposed to be at work?! Anyway, the line was halfway to the door when I stepped into the fray but we moved quickly. I ordered an espresso and bought a "healthy" muffin filled with blueberries, carrots, possibly zucchini, an apple slice and covered in oats. It was like a brick in my stomach. 

I don't know, I guess I don't get the whole "hang out in a coffee bar" thing. Especially students. Guess what guys there is a great place you can take your laptop and 30 textbooks and study in peace and quiet...a library. go there. 

Lux is cramped but everyone seems to love it. I'm all for independent businesses so Lux is A-Ok with me.

I'm so confused that I've never written a review. This is my favorite place for coffee and serious chilling or serious homework cramming. All the drinks are fabulous and the food is also really great with options! The wait is usually crazy long so be prepared for that. My favorite part is the decor and ambiance; I love the old little vintage plates they use and the mason jars full of iced coffee while you sit with a friend in big puffy pink chairs. This place is the best. Thank you lux never change
The Velvet coffee with their homemade whipped cream is so good!

One of the only coffee bars and speak-easy places that actually works and could fit in phoenix. I love the ability to work here on a Thursday early morning with a fresh cappuccino and a couple days later I can come back on a Saturday night and ask my awesome bartenders (Sasia and or Ben) to make a drink including ingredients I like or dislike, the true sign of a mixologist. The layout is  maze like and you will always find your nook and place to sit and study or sip on that delicious cocktail. More so, their beer selection and wine is on par! I was so surprised, as a vino lover, they had the coveted LIOCO chardonnay, this winery is notorious for only distributing to high quality local places, the only other places in Arizona I know of that have this wine? Are Binkleys (fancy!) and Postinos. The food here is also served late and that is key for someone who is out of work late and needs to do some tidy up work but also catch a delicious dinner (vegetarian friendly as well!). I am so happy to see this place transform form the former next door little coffee shop into something this extrinsic and delicious place on all counts.

This place has ruined us!  We live in LA and the best breakfast place we have ever been to is in freaking Phoenix?!?!?  Debating the merits of driving 5 1\/2 hours for good steak and eggs and Dutch pancakes.

The owner is also super personable!

We will be back!

Lux on a Friday night is just as busy as any neighborhood bar might be.  Instead, you have a wonderful warm beverage alternative to your glass bottled brew.  Lux serves iced beverages too, but let's face it: coffee is best served hot.  I sampled the ice mocha, per recommendation of a friend who's been frequenting the joint for some time.  Amazing!  I did feel a little crampy afterwards, but that could simply be because I don't usually drink dairy products.  The Rice Krispie treat was really tasty, but those are hard to screw up.  :)   The place was packed with some cool-looking people.  Everyone seems to keep to themselves as they work on their respective laptops.  In fact, some people even shared tables yet remained fixated on their own computers.  Really this place has a great vibe, and it made me feel like I was back in Europe.  I'd like to see soy or rice milk on the menu.  Otherwise, great coffee joint!

I went here last night for the first time and it was so cool! I had heard of it before, but had driven right past it not knowing it was there. It is kind of tucked away. It is a neat coffee shop\/bar. It was pretty crowded on a Friday night which I did not really expect. We ended up having to sit outside because inside was so packed. Also at one point it got so packed that strangers joined us at our table because there was no room anywhere else haha. However, it is packed for all the right reasons haha.
The baked goods looked so delicious. I was not hungry when I went, but I really want to come back and try something. This one person had like some kind of fancy looking pie cake thing. I also walked past a few people eating some sort of mac n cheese I think? Whatever it was, it looked amazing. The laid back atmosphere is great too, it was a nice place to hang out for a bit. people were playing board games and stuff near the entrance which looked like fun! There are like different sections too which I liked. A room that kind of looks like a theater, I thought that was an interesting touch for a bar\/ coffee shop. I just came for a drink and had a glass of malbec, which I really enjoyed. They served me a pretty large glad of wine too which was great for the price I thought! They have a pretty good wine selection which is awesome. It looked like they make good mixed drinks as well, I saw a bartender pounding and preparing rosemary for a drink. I would totally come back to try a drink like that the next time I come. The service was good too which is always a plus! 
I want to come earlier in the day and get a mocha or latte or something. This place was cool, I would like to spend more time here! Only complaint is how ridiculously crowded it was, I will have to try to come back at a time where Lux is not quite as busy as it is on a Friday night. Overall, I left impressed and happy with my visit!

Lux is my Sunday morning tradition. It's timeless. I've been going to Lux for years, and it's always been consistent. The service, food, drinks - all of it. 

They play great music too. 

Try the strawberry cornbread pastry, you'll be glad you did. Or the lemon cake!

Usually I'm a huge fan of this place but I came in earlier today and ordered an ice black and white. The girls making my drinks are busy chatting with each other and finally hand me my drink. By the time I get to my car I taste the coffee and all they did was make an iced latte.. that I paid $6 for.

Why Have I not rated this place yet?  Probably because I don't want it to get any more people in front of me in line to get some of the best espresso served in Phoenix.  Lux is amazing, no joke without this place I wouldn't of graduated from college.  They hours of operation is incredible, allowing students to crack down on their papers before their deadlines.  The range in menu is pure bliss.  From coffee to alcohol all the way to muffins to Steak dinners, if there isn't one thing on the menu you don't want, it's because you probably want it all.  It's sincerely my home away from home.  I'm there practically everyday.

What can I say that hasn't already been said? Lux is a breath of fresh air in a city cluttered with boring chain coffee joints. From the modern, eclectic aesthetics to the masterfully prepared drinks (including the yummy homemade, scoop-able whipped cream!) and the laid-back staff, Lux is always a treat. 

A life-long Phoenician, I've always had the "stay away from strangers" mentality. When I first went to Lux I was dismayed that even at a "slow" time I was forced to sit either on the same couch or at the same table as a stranger. Now I have assimilated to the environment that provides ample opportunity to easily strike up a conversation with fellow Lux-goers. Thank you Lux for melting this cold-stranger-averse exterior! 

The only reason I cannot give Lux 5 stars is the lack of outdoor comforts. The picnic-style tables stand in stark contrast to the comfortable seats and atmosphere found indoors. On a beautiful spring\/fall night (which I can only dream of at this time of year), I want to sit outdoors in comfortable seats, with a good cup of coffee and enjoy great conversation. Work with me Lux! 

In summation, if you like great coffee (or yummy baked goods!) and a fun, energetic atmosphere, Lux is the place for you. :)

The place is okay, nothing special..... customer service is great, but sitting is horrible..... nowhere to sit had to wait for someone to get up so we could sit..... I got one of the pies and it was NOT fresh, could not eat it by it self, so dry and o

Lux!  What a place!  Their coffee drinks are addictive and rapturously good. From their coffee to their chai teas to their lemonade. Don't even get me started on their baked goods!  The pastries are masterpieces and consistently delicious. The staff are friendly and invested in every customer who walks into the place.   The live DJ cannot be beat!  Finding a spot to lounge can get tricky at times because it does get crowded but one can't blame others for wanting to be there to enjoy the coffee, food and ambiance.

Good coffee. Good ambience. Easy parking. Lots of long tables which suited our group of 6. Employees were friendly. Had the quiche lorraine which would've been better if it were warm rather than room temp but it was still tasty.

Just about the hippest coffee spot- so much more than a coffee shop. Great food and service, free fast wifi. Excellent place to study and meet someone, conduct business. No wonder they named it Lux Central!

I like come to Lux  and pretend study. I've graduated college already but I like to come here and pretend like I'm doing something important while I sip on some coffee, check my Facebook account, check how many cool votes I got on Yelp and check the movie times using their free wi-fi. 

The place gets packed on the weekend so be prepared to have to scope the room out for an empty spot at the table or wait for someone to finish. I never usually have to wait very long.

The staff here is super helpful. If you don't see something on the menu, just let them know what you normally drink and they can make it for you. The selection of treats are amazing. Cherry oatmeal bars, snickerdoodles and diner cake. If the coffee doesn't get you wired, the sugar might. 

Its fairly quiet and has some music on but I usually just bring earplugs so I can secretly listen to Britney Spears. No one has to know about that. The guys who frequent this place are pretty cute, except their usually gay. Oh well... a girl can dream, can't she?!
I moved away from living right next to it and miss it every day.   The Egg Bake is amazing!

Love the Emerald Isle where you can choose the car you want and not get only one choice as in other rental companies.  We had a brand new Impala that had 125 miles on it and was clean and filled up so easy to leave terminal and upon return we were rushing and the receipt was handed to us in one minute.  Great service.

Lux. If you've tried their coffee, pastries, or other assorted goodies then you are likely  a believer. Yes they are are always busy. You will likely have to wait in some sort of line, depending on when you go. Your patience will be rewarded by your taste buds singing praise for a job well done. Most of their drinks tend to run less sweet (which isn't a bad thing) but they provide a variety of sweetener options to enhance the flavor to your preference.

I recommend picking up coffee beans if you have a grinder, or alternatively, I believe they can grind it for you.  This is truly a gem in Phoenix and without a doubt, my favorite coffee joint.
The coffee and food were great. Didn't love the scene, incredibly crowded with hipsters...... I guess that's not their fault but it stressed me out.

What a great family-owned concept! This is my first time dining here and I'm very impressed. From the pride that shows in the service and the great food and coffee, I will be recommending this restaurant to friends and family. 

The staff was so friendly and very helpful with me. If it's your first time, it can seem confusing but they quickly noticed I was a newbie and walked me through. 

The atmosphere is one that meets the needs of many; business meetings, school work, social fun, etc. They've done a fine job making this a unique experience making me look forward to my next visit..of which will be really soon. 

The menu looks incredible too. I started with a caramel latte which exceeded my expectations. So I couldn't help but order an odd combination of food; bacon and jalapeño mac and cheese, quiche, peanut butter cookies and corn bread\/berries muffin....I had company. All of them were fantastic.  The mac & cheese is amazing! 

I'll be back for sure!

Swung by here while waiting for a late afternoon flight. Good iced coffee, plenty of fresh ingredients by the look of the grill (surrounded by fresh vegetables). Eclectic atmosphere - reminded me of one of our coffee bars in Austin. Free wifi was very fast and the service was friendly. Seating was limited but other than that, no complaints!

Lots of outside and indoor seating (large picnic style tables with some normal tables). They feature a live DJ so it can be a bit noisy if you're trying to do serious work. Make sure you try the jalapeno with bacon mac and cheese! It is outstanding. 

The hot vanilla latte is a bit bitter, but the cold VL is very good (it is on the milkier side). The chai is a bit watery\/not very spicy, but is also foamy. The soy latte has a hint of sweetness.

Lux is my go-to cafe in downtown Phoenix and is great for late night hang outs.

Great place to sit with your laptop and drink coffee.

I luv Lux Coffeebar!  I would walk to this fabulous shop at least 3 times a week.  Its a great place to meet friends for coffee or to sit on the sofa with your laptop.  Awesome atmosphere.  I could sit there for hours listening to the music.  They offer an assortment of delicious baked goods.  On the plus side Pane Bianco is right next door.  Best place to grab a sandwich.

I have been to this location many times while visiting Phoenix and it is one of my favorite coffee shops in the area.  The coffee is delicious and the drinks are all made.  The only reason I can't give this place 5 stars is because every time I have been I have had a 5-10 minute wait for my drink even if there is no line.  The last time I went they took my order immediately and I paid immediately and then the wait was almost 10 minutes after before I received my drinks.  Other than that it is awesome and I will definitely return.

Lux is, according to my 28-year-old daughter, THE place to have coffee.  I like it fine, but don't feel as positive about it.  Lines can be long, service can be impersonal or slightly surly (which I prefer over the Dutch Bros overly friendly, chatty manner), it can be very crowded.  But it's A-OK, which is apparently what 3 stars means.
It took about 30 minutes to get mac n cheese so I asked for a refund and then they never even brought me my food. Worst customer service I have ever experienced.

Lux is very cool from top to bottom. From the ceiling to the floor and everything in between. I even feel cooler just being there. 
I've been about five times now and can't wait to take my wife. She's already cool but I digress....
It's creative vibe is unmatched anywhere else. I love to hang, do my design work on my laptop which is sitting 6 inches away from a typewriter (a clever little table center piece). I could go on and on about the superb food and coffee but I'll just touch on one tiny little detail that sets Lux apart. They give you a tiny little spoon with your cafe latte. Love it!

1500 reviews...I don't know what I can say that hasn't already been said.

Excellent biscuits and gravy and I crave their light roast with whipped cream. Wonderful pastry selection...I haven't had anything that I wasn't impressed with.

Parking lot is small so if you must park on the street, please pay attention to the street signs.

I've always wanted to come here, and I finally did tonight! Not a good first impression either. The girl at the register was ridiculously rude to me. I can safely say I've never been treated like that before! I'm sorry there was loud music and I couldn't hear, and I'm sorry you had to roll your eyes at me and raise your voice just a little bit louder. Seemed like an intentional rudeness too..maybe it's just me? Mac and cheese is good though.

I'm torn on how to rate them. Four stars? Five? It's in between the two options, but I think just slightly closer to four.
The food, especially the pasteries are excellent, the coffee is always perfect just as it is. I don't have to modify my order ever.
The music is just a weird mix which is easy (usually) to tune out. My main complaint is theyre always busy so the service is always rushed and never friendly. I mean they're not rude, far from it. It's just that no one there is personable or warm. 
I love the location though. It's walking distance from me, so I am there with my dog at least once a week.

First thing I need to say is...To all the douche bags that left one star negative reviews about this establishment.  Do us all a favor and stay your ass at home. Assholes like that have no right to be in public. Now on a positive note me and my husband came here for our Sunday morning breakfast. We got the pumpkin choclate chip muffins, the fruit and granola yogurt cup. Also got the oatmeal with seasonal fruit and walnuts. For drinks my husband got a medium dark roast coffee and I got the medium black and white mocha. Everything was great including the service. The place was very busy and the service we received was fast and friendly. They had a dj playing music and the atmosphere was pleasant. I highly recommend giving this place a visit. I know we will be returning again in the future. Thank u lux for the awesome experience.

Best cocktails I've encountered in Arizona. Coming from New York I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of service and product I was presented with at Lux. While they were busy on the evening I met up with some friends at the establishment, our bartender was cognizant of the wait and gave us a discount on our beverages!

I got to Lux around 8:30 am on Saturday morning and it was already packed with people. It was so packed that the cashier did not see that I was in line.  After I ordered they told me to go find a seat and they will call my name out at the counter when the coffee was ready. It was so crowded that it was difficult to find a space to sit, however, I finally found a seat near the bar at the high tables. After waiting for about 7-10 minutes for my coffee (while going back to check every few minutes), I found a cup of coffee waiting on the counter. I had not heard my name called because it was so crowded and loud inside. I actually ended up spilling my coffee when going back to my sitting area as it was so crowded. At that point I decided to pack up and leave as it was too loud to do any work. By the time I left (a span of about 15-20 minutes) the line to order was almost to the door.

I do have to make a note and thank the woman who worked at Lux who helped me clean up my spilled coffee and gave me all of my to-go containers for my scone and what was left of the coffee I ordered.

So as you can see, I was not a fan of the atmosphere. As for the coffee, I was able to salvage some of it after I spilled it. I had ordered a medium latte and it wasn't too bad. Not the best I've had however. I also ordered a bacon cheddar scone. That was very delicious.

Overall, I was not impressed with this coffee shop considering all of the high reviews it got. I will not be coming back.

Amazing coffee. One of my favorite places to go to get coffee and a snack. Amazing snacks and pastries. Great food. The staff is always amazing and can get some very decadent drinks while you either wait foe you food to go or sit down and eat it there and take in the atmosphere.

Great little hang out spot. Full bar, excellent coffee & tea, and great food. Definitely trendy. Good location, right off the light rail. If you're in the phoenix area and in the mood for something different, it's worth it!

I was in town for a meeting and needed coffee. I yelped and found this place... I asked the guy what coffee was strong but a bit sweet and he suggested a vanilla latte. I also ordered the egg sandwich with bacon on ciabatta. First, this place is super cute! The employees were nice and really sweet. Most importantly, my coffee was great! My sandwich... I wanted to eat this every morning for the rest of my life. So delish.... If I'm back in AZ any time soon,  you can find me there!

Great coffee and great pastries. The place is really small so there is not a lot of room to seat but if you are grabbing coffee on your way to work then this is a good spot. Do make sure to be patient since their system is not as sophisticated as Starbucks or other mainstream coffee spots. They like to do it their way and sometimes it can take a little. Nonetheless, the wait is worth it.

I am a hot chocolate and whipped cream afficionado.  I make my own whipped cream and have a nitrous-charged gourmet dispenser.

This is the best whipped cream and hot chocolate I have found in Phoenix.

It is next to Pane Bianco, if you haven't noticed from the 155 reviews of each place.  They complement each other very well.  Order at Bianco's and get a drink at Lux while waiting.  

Then, rock on with yo bad sef.
Really good spot to get some work done, if you can find a spot. It's not that bad if you are going alone, but if you want to meet a friend there, finding a spot for two can take some time.

AMAZING atmosphere! The energy in this place is captivating, from the creative decor to the friendly staff. Don't sleep on the mac n cheese! Such a simple dish that was made to perfection. The cheese was nice and creamy, and the noodles cooked to al dente. But to kick it up another notch, you have the option of adding thick bacon pieces and jalapenos! I couldn't get enough. Also, don't forget to get a drink. The bartenders are friendly and have a great knowledge in their area. Definitely recommend to anyone. Come in something comfy or a suit and tie. All walks of humans gather here to get homework done, finish a project you have been putting off, or even just to meet up with friends to catch up.
Love this place. Coffee, ambiance, and customers are all amazing food is pretty good too

I spent three days in Phoenix, which I was not thrilled about until I discovered Lux. I then proceeded to go to Lux three times in three days. 

Obviously this place doesn't need more good reviews (lol), but the coffee is stellar, the vibe is rad, and the food is more consistently delicious and unique than it really has any right to be considering how great everything else is. Even better, this joint is open LATE which is ideal for night owls and students alike. 

I am DISTRAUGHT to leave it behind. I nursed my very last iced latte sadly on the freeway back to my town. So my real question is: what does a girl have to do to get a Lux in Tucson, Arizona?? (I'll be waiting.)

Jeff, the owner, took what was a great coffee shop and turned it into an awesome destination experience. The place is always filled (which makes for some great people watching) and it is a treat just to kick back and relax. If you love coffee shops, this is a must!

Dear Seattle Supersonics and Howard Schultz,

I have forsaken Starbucks coffee since moving to AZ.  For one thing, Mr. Schultz, you suck (for selling the Sonics and for making a Grande latte $4.50).

I have moved on.  I am now--not so secretly--in love with Lux.  I get a "medium", otherwise known as grande to you, for $2.75 AND......ANDDDDD.......and my barista free pours the vanilla syrup.  I mean, it also tastes orgasmic, the coffee, that is.  By the way, I think their pastries are homemade.  Either way, their pastries are a DELIGHT!!  I always get the mixed berry corn bread muffin ($2.75) to go with my latte.  

Sincerely, 
A serious coffee addict

On a more serious note, they have outside seating with misters when the weather is scorching hot.  Since it's fall, the weather's been a lot nicer and this is a great hang out spot. They have their own parking and accept all major credit cards.  Their baristas are friendly and remember your name. This is a great place to get coffee and breakfast. No, they are not a franchise so you may have to drive a ways if you don't live in central phx...but hey, this is what makes their coffee affordable, orgasmic and worthwhile.  You should try them...at least once.

I like this place. It's pretty cool. My sister took me and I got a chai latte and a vanilla cupcake with espresso frosting. Yum....

The small drink size is SUPER SMALL, so be sure to get a medium.

The Good
*Great coffee
*Awesome cocktails 
*Tasty pastries 
*Fun staff
*Good atmosphere 
*Free WiFi

The Bad
*Can get overly crowded from time to time

The Bottom Line
Lux is fantastic coffee shop \/ cocktail bar that offers great food and drink. 

Review
The owners of Lux seem to have found the perfect balance between local relaxed coffee shop and fun vibrant cocktail bar. Due to this duality Lux always seems to be a busy place, allowing guests to work on their laptops or chat with thief friends. Durning the morning they offer locally baked goods and a small breakfast\/brunch menu. Their coffee is well brewed, roasted on site, and seems to be the coffee of choice for many restaurants in the Central Corridor area. In the evening the bar area comes to life and offers a wide variety of delicious cocktails served in original old school glassware. In addition to the cocktails the bar also offers an interesting selection of craft beers by the bottle or can.

I went to Lux for brunch with some friends and the food was pretty good. First off, the line was REALLY long, which is both good and bad. Bad, for obvious reasons, but good because it tells you that they are popular, which would usually hint at the quality of the food you will eventually consume. 

Second, they are kind enough to get drink orders while you wait in line so that you can start having your coffee, tea, juice, or whatnot, while you wait for your food. Third, the decor of Lux was cool enough to distract me while my friends and I waited for our breakfast to be prepared. Lots of retro-looking lamps on the tables combined with art from local artists made for a warm and welcoming atmosphere. 

When our food did arrive, we were all satisfied! I got the Aunt Gladys's homemade salsa over four strips of tender belly bacon, three scrambled eggs, white cheddar, and hash, which was pretty delicious. My two friends also really enjoyed their meals. I'm giving them 4 stars because I did think that their food was a bit over-priced for what you got, both in portion size and quality. I mean, it was $5 for a glass of orange juice... Other than that, I was very satisfied with the experience.
Adorable! I love the randomness of the seating. Egg sandwich with bacon was amazing. Iced coffee on point.

Fantastic coffee shop! Super adorable and the staff are so friendly. Whenever I go downtown I make sure to stop by, they have an excellent red velvet latte(hot and iced). Sometimes it can get a little crowded but hey who can blame them when they have such great coffee and service. Highly recommend if your a coffee lover
Delicious food! very hip! Good coffee! great place to grab a BLT and Mocha and do Homework. My go to Study place.

This little place is really cool if you need to study, meet with friends and\/or need a quick bite! It always pack. I think they are a bit expansive and this is why I gave them four instead of five stars...but you should absolutely visit and decide for yourself. I absolutely recommend it!

This place is the perfect meeting spot to catch up with friends,  and relax on a Sunday morning. The lattes are delicious, the Sunday dj plays right into the chill vibe, and there is always a spot to sit and chat. I look forward to my visits.

No no NO NO! I've been here enough times over the past couple of years to refute the hype, players! Yes this place is tragically hip and over-crowded like a b. But so whats?

Coffee and tea: good, like most specialty places that serve it (Cartel, Echo, Urban Beans, JoBot, etc etc etc). But let's talk about the REALITIES of a trip to (not)Lux.

There are many parking spaces that are usually taken. My guess is more than 70% of the crowd here are students who spend all day working over a cup of coffee and maybe a sssscccccooooonnnneeee. The "Order Here" counter is placed right along the entrance, so when lines back up, they are backing up into a seating area. God help you if that mommy with her two toddlers are seated at an entrance-area table. Good luck getting past that, boss.

The employees here are beyond obnoxious. Gave 'em multiple chances to be cool. They ain't. The baked goods are all pretty much blah\/dry\/not good. On our first visit to (not)Lux, we sampled much of the pastry menu to-go, because we had heard good things. But much like Cartel, Lux is all hype and not comfort, goodness or fun. It's pain. Pain to find parking. Pain to wait in the interminable line. Pain to deal with the 24-year-old baristas and register jockeys. Pain to find a place to sit. AAARRRGGGHHH!!!

If you're young and down to study and stare, this place is for you. If you aren't 18-25 and wearing flannel, jean shorts, Converse All-Stars, hipster glasses (prescription or otherwise), really wanna live in Portland, have iPod earbuds soldered into your head.............move along, because there's nothing to see here.
If I was a local, this would be my spot. We sat out on the patio next door with our caps and could not have been happier!

Love Lux! Fresh juice, coffee roasted on site, a variety of pastries made fresh daily. Urban scene, great music, cool art. Perfect for morning, afternoon and evening!

Katie whips up some of the best pastries and lunches in town. And the Croissant's? Better than Balthazar in NYC. Seriously. I mean it. The Croissants are to die for, but they don't come out of the oven until after 6:30 AM. 

During the summer, what is better than Iced Coffee? Hmmm.. the way Lux makes it- every Iced coffee is an Iced Americano with an extra shot of espresso. Couldn't get better.

One of my favorite things to going to coffee shops, whether it's at home or while traveling.  I should qualify this review with the fact I have not visited every coffee shop in the Valley, but I have been visiting Lux since they were in that small space that Pane Bianco took over.  I have always enjoyed the coffee and haven't met one of their baked items I didn't like...a lot.  They are also usually far quicker at getting my coffee drink to me than some other places.  I love the vibe here!

The Velvet coffee drink with whipped cream is the most amazing coffee I've ever had in my life.  It made Starbucks look like 7\/11.  I also had a peach upside down muffin which resembled a piece of pineapple upside down cake.  It was also really really delicious.  

I love the mix of modern, antique, and industrial.  I was there on a Saturday afternoon and there was a lot of seating available. The ladies room was clean.  There were some dirty dishes scattered around the place, but it was busy and I didn't really care- they were all picked up by the time we left.  There were a few hipsters in there, but my conservative suburbanite parents felt very comfortable in there as well.  

My only qualm was the lack of a menu and pricing.  If my friend hadn't recommended the Velvet I would've been totally clueless, and possibly disappointed.  While I was waiting in line I even pulled out my phone to check if their website had a menu, but couldn't find anything.  In the restaurant I could only find a list of teas (on a small piece of paper right by the register), and alcoholic beverages (on the glass wall).  Maybe I just wasn't looking in the right spot.

I will be back!

Met some fellow writers here for a drink. Fun place, packed with people. Very noisy, music loud, sunlight powering through the small windows high on the wall - my kind of place. 

The staff is courteous and eager to serve. Everyone is chill and I can't wait to return!
Love!!!!! Friendly staff, great coffee, great atmosphere, lots of space to do some work or just hang with friends. Good food and desserts! The bar is amazing too. The espresso martini is my fav!!!

This place is definitely interesting, but it's not for everyone, and I don't think it's for me, but t's ok. I'd still recommend going anyway just to try it and see what it's like. Incredibly heavy with hipsters, which is alright if that's your thing, but it's not really a place I'd go to hang out. Still it's fun to see something different. You almost forget your in Phoenix when there. It's fun\/interesting\/alright\/different, but realistically speaking, I probably won't be back.

My favorite coffee place by far. The iced velvet (white chocolate latte) is so tasty, especially when paired with a cup of the pesto mac n cheese. Seating is hard to find inside, but the benches outside are lovely and they always manage to find me when they bring my food out. Definitely worth the thirty minute drive. I also love the oatmeal cream pies, but they haven't seemed to have them in a while :(

Sure its hip but they have great coffee and tea as well. Tried their eggs with salsa on a bed of hash which was delicious. Substituted the bacon for fresh guac. Plenty of nooks and crannies to seat your fanny. Great place to catch up on work while enjoying great food and drinks. Becoming my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix.

Parking can be a real issue. The hipster vibe of the place is certainly not for me. My goal is to get in and get out ASAP. The place can be packed and chaotic but they do get you through the line fairly quickly. BUT--you'll be hard-pressed to find better coffee anywhere nearby. There are VERY few places within a half hour drive from here that has espresso this good. This is one of my go-to places for espresso beans.

This is my favorite special occasion coffee shop. I say that because it's so far from home so...I only go when I am downtown...which is usually special. The location is why they do not get 5 stars. I hate that they are far. I want them to be in my backyard....I mean come on...I have a pool and everything. 

The coffee and delicious treats are amazing.  Lots of tables to do table stuff. Lots of modern hipster chairs to do modern hipster stuff on. Outside seating is also available for those nature lovers. The art on the walls makes me wish I collected art. 

It's an all around good time...so go!
My new favorite coffee spot in Phoenix!! Absolutely the best coffee and pastries to get your caffeine and sugar fix all-in-one!

Items Selected:
Cold-brew Coffee
Lux Friand
Strawberries and Cream Scone
White Chocolate Raspberry Muffin
Blueberry Corn Muffin
Cinnamon Coffee Cake
Pecan Banana Nut Bread
Dutch Pancake with House-whipped Cream and Berries

Recommended by a well-traveled Las Vegas Chef, the hip vibe and Coffee program cited in addition to a substantial number of house-baked goods, it was just past nine on a rainy New Year's Day that three visitors settled into a couch of pink leather at Lux Central, the house already more than 3\/4 full with a growing line as a middle-age DJ spun shoegaze intermixed with other mid-tempo tunes.

Generally open 6am to Midnight, the late night leading to 2017 allowing staff to sleep in a bit, those arriving at 4400 North Central Avenue on 01\/01\/17 consisted of all ages and genders with a lean towards Millennials, a hirsuit young Barista taking orders from the line and passing them on to a colleague in order to expedite traffic while a team of clerks gathered pastries and generated tickets for orders requiring preparation from a postage stamp-size kitchen in the back.

Focusing mostly on Quick Breads and American classics, glamour-shots of David Bowie and Chewbacca contributing to the décor, it was after slow perusal approaching the counter that a sizable order was formulated, a total of six pastries presented on five plates with twenty-minutes quoted as the wait time for a $9 Dutch Pancake.

Not in any rush, the leisurely morning a welcome change of pace from days prior, it was with self-gathered silverware that a tasting got underway, first bites of the Strawberry Scone trending sweeter and softer than the British staple while the Raspberry Muffin was minimally different in texture, the small chunks of White Chocolate simply replacing pockets of melted Butter in the former.

Smiling at the $1 Friand with a cursive "L," essentially a Hostess Cupcake made dense with better Cocoa, Lux Central's Coffee Cake as well as the Banana Bread do an admirable job of negating Phoenix's dry-air by dialing up the wet ingredients, the Blueberry Corn Muffin also showing well with what seems to be a 1\/3 each ratio of Butter, Berries and Cornmeal. 

A bit compromised by crowding, a lack of table service requiring diners to be attentive to their name being called out from a kitchen nearly 30-yards away from the door, it was precisely nineteen minutes after ordering that the high-walled Pancake was collected, a crisp rim surrounding no less than four types of fresh Fruit plus a sizeable dollop of hand-whipped Cream that made any thoughts of Syrup unnecessary.

I'm generally not a fan of businesses that don't bother with the convenience of posted signage. I came by and nearly left because the posted address goes to an office and the entrance around back appeared to be for another restaurant. Eventually we found our way, but it's a douche move to intentionally limit your patronage to those "in the know".

But goddamn if the coffee and desserts aren't the best I came across in the greater Phoenix area. The Lux salted cookie sandwich and a cappuccino made an incredible dessert that had me eating my words about this place being a bunch of pretentious, artsy bullshit. I mean, it is, but I guess if you have the skills to back it up, you can get away with it. The barista who helped me was friendly enough, but some sort of organization to the ordering system should be appreciated, as it was mostly a herd of people standing in front of the registers until they were summoned by staff. 

Great late-night stop to catch up with friends over drinks or sweet treats. Snag a copy of their cute-ass menu with vintage drawings and old-school dining specials. Outdoor seating available, since indoors is limited and smoke-free. Were their holiday hours not limited, we would have made the 10 mile trek out of our way to visit again before leaving town. Will make a point of returning when I'm back in a few months.

Great stop in central Phoenix for some great coffee.
I've been coming to Lux for a while now and have been pleasantly surprised with great coffee, food and customer service.

If you haven't been to Lux yet, please do so. Hidden away, it brings Phoenix phenomenal coffee. For breakfast, I recommend getting the quiche or the egg bake. When fall comes around make sure to get yourself a pumpkin whoopie pie (you'll thank me later). 

Every time I have been it has been packed- yet all the staff are friendly and very accommodating. But the biggest reason I decided to write this review was not even based on the iced-coffee or the yummy pastries.

Yesterday, after leaving Lux I realized I had lost my set of keys. I decided to call Lux to see if I had left them behind. Elena answered the phone and I told her my situation. Not only was she kind, she also went around Lux while on the phone with me to search for my keys. She even went to the parking lot and tried to find them there. I was pleasantly surprised with her thoughtfulness to search for my keys for me. Though she wasn't able to find them while I was on the phone with her-she assured me that she would call me back if anything came up. She also proceeded to tell me to have a good day and good luck finding my keys.  So thank you Elena, for restoring my faith in humanity and for being such a kind individual. Make sure you all leave a tip for my girl Elena!

Really nice place with good vibe and really good food. I was traveling and needed a good breakfast place when I stumbled on this gem. Walked over to find a very busy place. But I was not ignored. Received help right away on the menu questions and placed my order. My breakfast and desert with tea was delish. I would totally recommend this place. Wish we had one in California. Yamm!!

Cool spot! Loved how they had a little bit of everything -coffee bar, pastries, real food, and real drinks (alcohol).  Lots of different areas to sit chat or do work! Coffee was good I got the mocha latte- wasn't biter at all! Will defiantly be back to try some of the other goodies
The place is hard to find. Entrance is around back. The coffee and cookies were great. The vibe is definitely hipster.

I am extremely picky when it comes to coffee shops because I own one back in Washington. The atmosphere is wonderful and the pastries are amazing, when my husband and I come visit this is our 1st place we come before seeing our son in college..Try this place and you will be hooked.

I really like the food and the atmosphere however on more than one occasion I have waited over 10 minutes in line only to have the employee tell me they just stop serving food A minute a go when I get to the register. They really need better communication around this to people waiting in line it's very frustrating.

I came to Arizona from Washington and was shocked at the lack of good coffee shops. When I walked into Lux, my desperate search came to a halt. The coffee is spectacular, the people are down to earth, and the bar-area has a great selection of beer! 

Basically, if you come from anywhere outside Arizona and are used to great coffee (and the thought of Starbucks appalls you), this is your place. Yes, it is packed and it takes a while to get your drink, but if you can go in an off-hour, it's the perfect place to sit down and enjoy a cup.
Coffee and espresso are nothing super special the atmosphere is great some of the baristas are stuck up. Delicious Mac and cheese !!

This is probably the coolest coffee shop in town. The employees are so sweet and the coffee is delicious. I've been coming here almost everyday for the last year and I have always gotten the best service.

This place is amazing. Came here to study with my fiance, and we loved it. I got the hibiscus iced tea (which comes with unlimited free refills) and my fiance got iced coffee. They have free wi-fi, and we never felt like any of the employees wanted us to leave or move from our spots. Got a solid 4 hours of studying done here. Would highly recommend.

Environment is super cool! Lots to look at and comfortable chairs and seating area.  Hipster-like and very industrial looking as far as decor.  Would be great to come and do some homework or meet up with friends- not very quiet though If that's what you're in to.  Got a medium almond milk latte and it was amazing with no flavor ($5.50) and my sister got the medium hot velvet (5.50) and we loved both! Get the homemade whip cream it was amazing!!!!

This is my favorite coffee place because not only is the coffee so amazing, but the food scene that hey provide here continues to blow my mind every single time. I drive 45 minutes to visit Lux and I am never disappointed. I feel that their prices are an absolute steal because the ingredients they use for their coffee, pastries, and meals are so fresh that it's unlike anything you've experienced before. However, I will warn that it is almost ALWAYS busy. And I mean like line out the door busy. So plan to try it out when you have a little extra time on your hands!
Hip place.  Can be busy at times.  Perfect for study and a drink or two.  Lunch is quaint.

I am upgrading my review of this place after having a caramel latte that was excellent and finding a pink leather couch. Not hot pink, but the color pink of the Caddies that Mary Kay "winners" drove back in the day.

On top of that, the baristas are really nice even if they might be laughing internally, they never let their emotions be seen on their faces, just genuinely sincere baristas.

When you think of the great coffee shops of Arizona one name sticks out above the rest... Lux. The word lux actually refers to illuminating light and this place just lights up central Phoenix like nobody's business. So it seems that when naming this grand coffee shop, the owners knew what they were doing. Now in order to have a successful and popular coffee shop, many aspects come into play. First and foremost, the coffee must be outstanding... you could have all the other important parts such as great ambiance, food, space, parking or free wifi... but if your coffee is no good, the people will go elsewhere.

This place happens to have it all! from the moment you either park on the street or on the lot, you know you're headed to the gem of the neighborhood. There are ALWAYS people here... that is the first sign of feeling the reassurance of going to the right place. as you walk through the entrance, the aroma of the ground coffee beans just invades your senses and your body just feels that "I am at home" comfort level.

The set up in this place is pretty sweet. Spread all throughout this coffee house are seperated rooms full of varried couches, benches, sofas, chairs, tables and work areas. This place is suited for everyone from the student to the professional and from the reader to the social butterfly. In one of the rooms, there is even a tv which they play sports on for the hipster fan :)

Straight back from where you walk in, there is the barristas' counter joined by the small exposition kitchen. They have fresh pastries available as well as fresh fruit, eggs, etc. They seem to have a bit of something light or heavy for everyone. As for the most important part of this venue, the coffee, they seemed to have come close to perfection with their blend of beans. Whether you order it black, mocha'ed, latte'ed, iced or hot... the flavor is never disappointing. What is also nice, are the variety of mixers for your coffee. They have soy, almond milk, low fat, skim, whole, etc. You name the drink and they shall make it. A traditional espresso drink has two shots but if you need that extra boost, they will happily upgrade you to the quad.

Now, in addition to the cafe part of this place there is a bar nestled in the back corner facing the entrance. If you are just not feeling the mood of coffee just the coffee house, one can order wine, boutique beer or even a refreshing cocktail. Not many modern day coffee shops have this additional amenity. It's nice to have the option when you are in a bit more relaxed and or social mood. The bartenders seem to have enough knowledge to concoct most drinks the average person can come up with, so don't hold back!

All in all, this place is doing it right. It all started with an idea that sprouted into this diamond in the desert. My only criticism is that this place is becomming SO popular, that it is almost losing that comfortable casual feel because of the crowd. My suggestion... open another location!!!!! :)

I met my husband here, so I'm a little biased :)

... But that's exactly why I love Lux so much. It's very communal, chill and friendly which makes it a great place to meet cool people. When I first moved here three years ago, I didn't know a soul. So I used to go sit at Lux with my laptop every night. Despite being super shy, I'd always get chatted up by at least one person (many were cute dudes trying to hit on me, but also lots of lovely platonic friend-types, too). You won't find a more diverse mix of interesting people on a weeknight. 

My Lux ritual helped me make friends, learn about PHX & break out of my shell. 

Also: the lattes and baked goods are bomb diggity awesome. And though you wouldn't necessarily expect to get great eats at a coffee house, dinner is AMAZING too. 

Thank you Lux for feeding me, entertaining me & helping me get hitched. XOXO

This is the best coffee bar I've ever been to, and I've been to a lot of cool coffee places. First off, the coffee is really good, which is obviously the most important thing you look for in a coffee place. But Lux was so much more than that. They had an incredible baked goods selection (the apple tart was delicious), a full menu of interesting foods, a mixologist on staff, and even a live DJ. That's right, a DJ, and I went on a friday afternoon. 

I went for lunch so I got the dutch pancake with potatoes, broccoli, spinach, cauliflower, topped with cheese. It was one of the most unique meals I've ever had but also one of the best lunches I've ever had. 

There was a good amount of seating, both outside and inside. Was the place hipster? Of course. Everyone had been mentioning that in their reviews. I haven't been able to figure out why white dudes with dreads and gauges makes coffee and food better but it does. That being said, Lux is not in short supply of said hipsters. And everything is unbelievable.

I drive 20 miles regularly just to come here! Love the amazing interior decorating and superb coffee (it's the perfect kind of coffee to wash down pastries, especially when it's iced). There are so many kinds of people who come here, but everyone, from the employees to the customers, is very friendly. My cousin and I got a peanut butter brownie (amazing) and got up for a coffee refill a couple hours later, and almost the entire pastry case was different. They're always baking their pastries fresh, but if you have something specific in mind, it may not be there when you arrive because they're always rotating. That's okay, try something else, you won't be let down! The food quality is great, so I don't mind paying a bit extra for it. The ideal student's\/worker's cafe - there are rooms that have a tendency to be quiet for those who need them. What more could you ask for in a coffee shop?

This is a review of the Chai. I had high hopes. Over a thousand reviews and still maintaining over four stars - somethings gotta be good. Unfortunately it isn't the Chai. The dominant flavor of said Chai was the milk. That's a bummer. Couldn't really taste any tea, honey\/sugar, cinnamon. Just kind of a watery, milky drink. I've very honestly had better Chai at a QT - at least its cheaper. 

I'm sure they must do other stuff well. They seem to be well-loved. The baked goods look pretty good, and I assume the coffee is good, I just don't drink coffee. 

The Chai is really one star, but the place has a nice ambiance to it, and the soap in the bathroom was actually quite nice (lol), and so I compromise at two stars.

One of my go-to places when I need to study or write. Wifi is surprisingly fast for the amount of people jammed inside this place on their laptops. 

Super cool staff. They accidentally charged me three times and were quick to remedy the situation with some Lux Bux. 

Really good chai lattes and fresh baked pastry concoctions. Open til' 10 most nights.

I must admit I feel so uncool every time I come in here, mostly because it's hipster supreme and everyone seems to know everyone. But I sit in here and work because the atmosphere is both simple and eclectic -- I love the openness behind the counter and the openness of the seating area. Plus, good tunes always seem to abound here. Did I mention the coffee is delicious? Smooth, caramelly espresso; not at all the like the bitter over roasted crud at a certain worldwide coffee tyrant. I also highly dig that they worked the tax into all of their prices, so when I buy an Americano for $2.50, it's really $2.50. One more thing: enjoy the pastries here. They are as good as any coffeehouse I've visited.
I just love going here to get my favorite drink look at the hot bartenders and listen to good music.

first of all, if you're driving at night and over 20 mph on central ave, you're probably going to miss this place. and when you miss it, you're going to have to take a 10 minute detour to make a u-turn because that damn light rail makes it impossible to maneuver quickly in downtown phx. but if you find a way to make it in, you'll feel like you're in a posh pee-wee herman's coffee house. the furniture is unique as the crowd. they have good baked goods, and i guess now they serve dinner as well. didn't try the dinner, but people were eating it, so that probably means it was edible. if you want coffee and a snack or a place to study, make the trek, but bring a taser in case someone tries to rob you. shady area, but if you travel with a friend, you'll have a great time.
There iced Carmel macchiato is the best! You need to check this place out. There open late! It's very hipster in here and great place to hang out
The atmosphere, employees, and coffee are all absolutely amazing! Although they were packed, the vibe was awesome and I plan on coming in a lot more often.

Slightly chaotic for this first time patron, but the egg sandwich was AWESOME! My friend talked it up last night and it totally delivered! The roasted tomato is definitely the best part ;) #nomnomnom

Despite living a little while away, I'll definitely be back again! #happygirl

Went here for the first time a couple weeks ago. It was pretty busy but the staff was polite and courteous and the atmosphere was exactly what you want for a trendy coffee shop.

We had to sit outside but their shaded seating kept us cool, I definitely will be visiting again when I'm in the area!

Delicious coffee, beautiful atmosphere. We are on a girls road trip from NM, stopped to refuel and stretch. There were a few other spots with more 5 star reviews close by, but the pics and the back patio sold me- stop for your one break on a twelve hour drive here. Totally not let down, Phoenix has never felt so relaxing, breezy or better for road trip picnic with STELLAR coffee. Thank you Lola's!

Best coffee!!!  How do you say this place is f*ckin amazing. The music is always great, the service is fabulous and the coffee is ALWAYS 100% perfection. The baristas are really baristas making the coffee feel like drinking the best art.

Price point was a little bit high for what it was (portion to price ratio).  Food was delicious though and the drinks were good and the the bartender really knew her shit.  It was packed and everybody there was oh so cool and hip.  I'd go back if I was in the area (maybe).

When I visit a new city, the first thing I try to find is the city's perfect coffeeshop! I think Lux takes it for Phoenix. 

Casual, hip, & trendy atmosphere. Their decor was a mix of simple, modern with a vintage twist, I loved it! The workers were very outgoing and friendly which is always a big plus. It was hard to find seats because it was super packed but I'm not complaining.

The noise level was pretty loud so I didn't understand how people were studying here. It seems more like a place for social outings. All in all, I enjoyed my experience at Lux.

I love this place. The line moves quickly even when busy and the coffee wait isn't long. The food and coffee is delicious. The atmosphere is great, but it can get busy at times with no space to sit down and enjoy your coffee. 

P.S. The whip cream is amazing.

It's impossible to find something bad about this place. The moment I step off the plane at PHX, I immediately crave Lux. The mac and cheese is perfect, gooey and cheesy, not like the stuff you made in college. The ambiance is so unique and the whole atmosphere can't be replicated. Coffee is the highlight though, lattes, cappucinos, iced drinks! They really know what they are doing here. The people are friendly and very very very cheery. A+++

Lux on Central never disappoints. My boyfriend and I have become regulars here. Great place to hang out with close friends. Or if you prefer to be solo and focus on getting some work done this place provides the perfect atmosphere. With multiple outlets throughout the lounge you will be able to get a charge without being secluded. 

Recommendation: Jalapeño mac and cheese

Bacon cheeseburger on english muffin 

ANY of their hand crafted cocktails.

Great selection of beer.  Very quite, relaxed atmosphere with a projector TV playing the latest sports events.  
They have a selection of baked items and breakfast.  They also double as a coffee shop. We didn't try the coffee but we will next time.  
Alley enjoyed the cool cement floor and all the attention she got from the college students doing their homework Sunday afternoon.  She will be back!!!

Went to this coffee shop seeing the great reviews. Good coffee, friendly staff and thoughtful seating & interiors. 

Finding the coffee shop was little difficult though. No signs anywhere around the building or even at the front door.

Hobo chic coffee shop downtown.. always is buzzing when I come through. Ordered some delicious looking pastries for my customers- a vegan, lemon poppyseed donut, a strawberry, blackberry, almond pie dusted with powder sugar and blueberry corn muffins. Didn't get to taste any, but they are definitely appealing to the eye. Also offer breakfast items to order. Their coffees are beautiful, as they add an artful touch to the beverages with cream or milk added. I opted for cold brew with 2 Espresso shots and was not disappointed!! So yummy! Had a house DJ playing chill music at 10am on a Friday morning.

This coffee shop reminds me of pretty much every coffee shop in Portland Oregon. Which is probably why like it so much their pastries are amazing the food is great and the coffee is equally as good. The line goes fast they make every effort so people aren't waiting in line for a long time.

It's pretty happily have a good choice of seating throughout the restaurant area they even have a TV room or you can watch basketball and sports they have awesome culture. All different types of people calm located in a great area my only downside to this place is the parking. I literally almost got killed by some lady who thought I was taking her spot but I was leaving the parking lot and people are nuts about their parking in this place there's maybe 15 parking spots for the entire place. And I think that might even be shared with another place. anyways. That's the only downside I can think of other ways I highly recommend this place bring your coffee connoisseurs because this place will definitely meet the mark! :)

By far one of the best local coffee shops I have visited in the valley. Their mocha was creamy and flavorful, and left me wanting more. I have permanently added this coffee shop to my favorites list.

Thank you!

I just had the best mocha in my life! Great location off the light rail near Campbell. Unfortunately my first visit was during finals week and the place was swamped. I waited 10 min for my mocha and then found that no one knew of my order. But they responded well and quickly brought it right out to where I was sitting.

My first time in , from CA originally:) 
They asked me what I like to drink, I told them I like cocktails and beer but felt like a cocktail ... I suggested Long Island , even though they don't make them they made there style of it and it turned out beautifully !!! , the atmosphere was cozy and Sheek!! The drink even came in a mason jar with a lemon and metal straw\/stir spoon ;) delicious!!

I have been dying to try Lux for awhile and I finally made it... definitely worth the wait.  I came here for the Yelp book club meeting and since it was kind of late in the afternoon I decided to try the hot apple cider with whipped cream instead of coffee... it was sooo delicious!  I will have to come back to try their coffee because that is after all their main offering.  All of their pastries, muffins and cakes, etc looked amazing and I had to use a lot of self control not to try one.

Unique experience, first time I've visited a coffee roaste\/restaurant\/bar! Great concept!

Like:
Ambiance
Iced coffee
Unique experience
They roast their own coffee

Wish:
I could've actually stayed to enjoy my coffee & take in the atmosphere. When I return to Phoenix I will visit for sure!

Good food, easy to meet and work here, and a friendly staff, however the furniture is very old and it's typically over-crowded. The "trendy-ness" of the place doesn't make up for the fact that I feel slightly uncomfortable sitting in some of the old, torn chairs. I've had various meetings here, which it's great for if you're able to find the space and don't mind raising your voice to speak to whomever you're with.

That all said, the breakfast sandwich is ONE OF THE BEST in the whole valley.

Heard so many great things about this cafe from a friend who used to lived out in Phoenix for years. 

Finally got the chance to come out & check it out myself, I have to say the entire concept of this place is pretty badass. The second we walked in we were greeted by a line almost out the door, can't blame them with such great variety of pastries. 

Had a difficult time making up my mind on what to get since everything looked amazing, staff happily assisted me on how to order and gave me great recommendations of their liking. 

Pastries were so superb that we stayed for lunch as we were curious to see what the food was like. 

Even ended up taking some road snacks, I rarely say this but believe me everything here was amazing.

I really enjoyed the fact that they had a DJ inside lol 

Get the vegan donuts! I'm not vegan but they were so bomb.com

Didn't have a positive experience during our visit, and perhaps they were just having an off night? My BFF and I were in town, and I was in town for a work conference. When I travel I usually visit a local coffeehouse and support small local businesses. When I saw that Lux was nearby and had outstanding reviews, I told my BFF we had to come after our dinner. We drove to Lux, and it was packed. There is a small parking and then street parking. We luckily found a spot in the lot, and inside we went.

We were a little confused as to how to order. There seemed to be a couple lines or just people standing around waiting for their orders ? I do appreciate that there was an employee who were taking orders while people were standing around so that people had less wait for their drinks. My friend had ordered a house drip coffee, and since I can't drink regular coffee at night, I asked the lady at the register if they served decaf. The lady gave me a dirty look and said "no!". Talk about attitude! I know this is a coffee house, and perhaps you may not serve drip decaf, but no need for attitude! Even my BFF mentioned that she had attitude and wasn't professional. Since I didn't get any coffee, I ended up getting a cookie to go.

We were considering eating a light snack, but after our customer service, we decided to just leave. There were lot of people studying in the coffeehouse and the tables were filled. Seemed like a nice place to hang out, but based on our experience, we aren't coming back. Very unfortunate.

I'm a regular here for a reason. The coffee and pastries are great and service always friendly. Sure the place is full of hipsters on their Macs but I see all kinds of people here, never snobberish. Can get loud and people get way too comfortable at times (get your feet off the table) but overall...great place.

Only reason i can't give 5 stars is because this place is packed! Only because their food, coffee, and other beverages are the best in the area, along with a very friendly staff making sure you are taken care of!

I got the fennel and gruyere scone and an iced nonfat latte. The latte was so smooth and flavorful! The fennel and gruyere scone was such a treat too! The layout of the place is really confusing though, and it took me a little while to figure out where the menu was (clipped to the glass by the pastries), but I think the scone and drink were both very good and I would come back.

Hipster. coffee.
Those two words pretty much sum up any decent review of this place. Everything else is just details. So...the details. This is a nice coffee shop in Phoenix. We drove around the block a few times before finding it since there aren't any signs anywhere. You basically walk into an unmarked door and...hipsters. everywhere. We went here on a Saturday morning while we were out exploring, and it was pretty crowded. This is a get to know your neighbor type of place. Unless your neighbor is set up at a table with an iMac, in which case don't get chatty. Still the coffee and the pastry were good and I could see this being a nice place to hang out as long as you don't mind people and noise.

So in love with Lux! Trendy doesn't quit cover it. People watching is priceless. Chill environment. Great, food coffee and wine. Mac and cheese with jalapenos and bacon is unreal! Sport (football, basketball, ect...) in the back room on a huge screen entertains my son and boyfriend so I can get some chill time in. Staff is so friendly and personable. Thoroughly impressed!

Lux is my favorite, everything here is fantastic. All the barista's know your drink and have a welcome smile to see you. Pastries are made on site, ample in selection and are delicious. If you think you're too chubby for cake there's usually fresh fruit hanging around and yogurt in the mornings. Free wi-fi and free people watching are a bonus to this dimly lit and cozy atmosphere.
Lux feels trendier than I'd prefer BUT their Mac-n-Cheese is to die for.  Go get some!  You won't regret it.

Overall great place to come and relax, whether it be to drink coffee or get a couple of cocktails with friends. The food and pastries are also great! The only con to this place is how packed it can be at times but you just have to come in at the right time. I would recommend the sweet dutch pancake and velvet coffee, both are very amazing together.

This was my first time here and I loved it. It's hidden away with no sign out front because everyone already knows about this place. If you want to be a pretentious Macbook Pro hipster to write your next novel, come here. If you want to chill out with friends and talk, come here. The atmosphere is dim and chill at night and they have inside and outside seating that's always bustling. Parking can be hard sometimes because this place is so good.

I had an order of hot chocolate and it was creamy and delicious. The barista drew a beautiful leaf design in the cream on top; if they day is slow, they'll take their time to show off their talents with detailed art that makes me not even want to drink it because I'll ruin it. I love details like that. 

Their mac 'n cheese dish is made and baked perfectly and everything is served in big coffee cups that make you feel at home. The music they play there is very different and not Top 40 which is something I always appreciate. The experience is delightful and I would recommend this place for sure!
Cappuccino was delicious! Cool place to listen to good music and work.

Great decor, cool vibe, but my first visit ended up with a poor macchiato. A little light on the foam and grounds - yes grounds - in the cup. I really wanted to like it since I had heard great things, but that's a pretty bad gaffe. I'm hoping I just caught them on a bad night so I might try them again when I'm in the area.

Called for reservations for 15 to 18 people.  They. Told us to call back to find out exact number.  Called 15 minutes later and Spoke with Chris, the manager.  He said they aren't taking any reservations and to haveus walk in with 15 people.  Rude!  I personally can't stand their food but it was for someone who likes their bean dip.  Never will I go there again!

We sincerely need something like this in San Francisco. (Closest thing: The Grove.) this place is amazing. Big, industrial cozy vibe, open lots of hours, diverse crowd, great baked goods (incl paleo cookies), full kitchen, lots of seating configurations, great hipster music, tasty coffee. Total winner of a place.

Nice atmosphere, and a good variety of coffee-house food and drinks, the only real problem is they are so often so busy, so there is usually a line and not necessarily a place to sit.
Definitely skews younger.

I hadn't been by here in awhile simply because they've grown to be so incredibly busy! I used to hangout whenever I could, back before they had a bar or served food. I'm happy for all the amazing success they've had but it's just become too hard to get a seat let alone parking! Regardless of all that though, they have some of the best coffee in town & the most amazing baked goods! Everything is made fresh in house & you can tell! Their food is also always delicious & reasonably priced. The bartenders take their jobs very seriously & will gladly pour you a drink or ask them to make something custom & you'll really see their skills come out! This is definitely still the spot to check out if you want a downtown experience.

Very comfortable place. Tried the mocha velvet...i like it a lot. Although I enjoyed the selection of music I initially thought it was a little loud.  I got "engrossed" in the work I brought with me so got used to the music level rather quickly. The lady next to me was crunching on a toasted ciabatta which smelled heavenly. Ahhh...perfectly toasted bread. Definitely a simple pleasure worth savoring. 

Only wished this place was closer to my neck of the woods. Oh, and no outlets to plug in laptops.

What a great cozy place.  Early morning to late evening you can find a little something to eat or drink.  It feels like you are in your grandmas house on a holiday with laughter people conversing and eating the day and night away.  It caters to singles and families alike with friendly owners frequenting their establishment often.  I have not been here yet where they are not busy, but the jam thru without skipping a beat with a smile on their face. I have been to several places in the surrounding area and as I walk to Lux I bypass a couple coffee shops that process 3 people slower and with lower quality products then Lux can with a 20 foot line out the door.
